revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-07 09:48:29.000000000', 'files': ['rally-jobs/keystone-v3-only.yaml', 'tests/hacking/checks.py', 'tests/unit/test_rally_gate.py', 'rally-jobs/neutron.yaml', 'rally-jobs/manifest-mos.yaml', 'rally-jobs/rally-mos.yaml', 'rally-jobs/ec2.yaml', 'rally-jobs/keystone-v2-only.yaml', 'tests/ci/rally-gate.sh', 'tests/ci/rally_gate.py', 'rally-jobs/keystone.yaml', 'rally-jobs/sahara.yaml', 'tests/ci/rally-gate/index.mako', 'tests/ci/rally-gate.py'], 'message': 'Add new script for rally-gate jobs

This script does support manifest file with list
of scenarios and environment configurations.

Manifest is yaml file of following format:

---
 section_name:
   env:
     common_env_name: ["args1", "args2"]
   tasks:

  nova:

          rally: ["0.0.3", "0.0.4"]

Please note: in the latest section of sample manifest file
the scenario will be ran 4 times:

 keystone v2 + rally 0.0.4

Manifest filename may be specified via RALLY_MANIFEST
environment variable.
If variable is missing then script will try to open
rally-scenarios/manifest.yaml or rally-jobs/manifest.yaml.
If file still does not exist then legacy behavior will be used.

Change-Id: Ice85a94abb9ac7267a1ae9fb41b480adaf58b4b6
'}]
commit_message:
Add new script for rally-gate jobs

This script does support manifest file with list
of scenarios and environment configurations.

Manifest is yaml file of following format:

---
 section_name:
   env:
     common_env_name: ["args1", "args2"]
   tasks:
    - file: task-filename.yaml
      env:
        local_env_name: ["variant1", "variant2"]

Sample manifest file:

---
  nova:
    env:
      keystone: ["v2.0", "v3"]
    tasks:
      - file: rally-jobs/nova-1.yaml
      - file: rally-jobs/nova-2.yaml
  keystone:
    tasks:
      - file: rally-jobs/keystone-v2-only-scenarios.yaml
        env:
          keystone: ["v2.0"]
  rally:
    tasks:
      - file: rally-jobs/rally-dummy-scenarios.yaml
        env:
          keystone: ["v2.0", "v3"]
          rally: ["0.0.3", "0.0.4"]

Please note: in the latest section of sample manifest file
the scenario will be ran 4 times:

 keystone v2 + rally 0.0.3
 keystone v2 + rally 0.0.4
 keystone v3 + rally 0.0.3
 keystone v3 + rally 0.0.4

Manifest filename may be specified via RALLY_MANIFEST
environment variable.
If variable is missing then script will try to open
rally-scenarios/manifest.yaml or rally-jobs/manifest.yaml.
If file still does not exist then legacy behavior will be used.

Change-Id: Ice85a94abb9ac7267a1ae9fb41b480adaf58b4b6

commit_message:
Add "self" venv to use it in self (dummy) tests

Copy Dummy* scenarios from main rally.yaml file to rally-self.yaml
Add sh script which creates rally database if not exists and runs task
Use `tox -eself' to run self tests

Change-Id: Ia08536288e48b8f6571508c3fd9f5a433e78d55d

subject: Workaround eventlet bug with subunit on python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-23 21:38:16.000000000', 'files': ['.testr.conf'], 'message': "Workaround eventlet bug with subunit on python 3

This commit adds a workaround to the testr.conf which simply pipes the
output of the test command through cat to ensure we don't end up with
partial writes in the subunit stream. Without this we can potentially
end up with an incomplete write in the subunit stream which results
in a broken stream. This issues has been documented upstream in both
eventlet [1] and subunit [2] and the fixes will likely happen soon,
but in the meantime we need to workaround the issue.

[1] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/248
[2] https://github.com/testing-cabal/subunit/pull/14

Change-Id: Ia4294cdd5e5873fca8bdb9cd97c8c37ad0c88471
"}]
commit_message:
Workaround eventlet bug with subunit on python 3

This commit adds a workaround to the testr.conf which simply pipes the
output of the test command through cat to ensure we don't end up with
partial writes in the subunit stream. Without this we can potentially
end up with an incomplete write in the subunit stream which results
in a broken stream. This issues has been documented upstream in both
eventlet [1] and subunit [2] and the fixes will likely happen soon,
but in the meantime we need to workaround the issue.

[1] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/248
[2] https://github.com/testing-cabal/subunit/pull/14

Change-Id: Ia4294cdd5e5873fca8bdb9cd97c8c37ad0c88471

subject: Add a warning for new mitaka releases of oslo.messaging
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-24 02:51:54.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/mitaka/oslo.messaging.yaml'], 'message': "Add a warning for new mitaka releases of oslo.messaging

Neutron (and possibly others) were/are using a private symbol of
oslo.messaging  several reviews have been put in place to mitigate this
including a requirements change that bans
!=2.6.0,!=2.6.1,!=2.7.0,!=2.8.0,!=2.8.1,!=2.9.0 from liberty

If a new release is tagged in the range >2.6.0 <3.0.0 it will NOT be
banned and may introduce a regression.

A release in that range is doable but we need to be careful.  Add a
warning to that we don't forget and do that thing.

Depends-On: I5d15366a212c6ed21f33bfe011876fc2bb56997c
Change-Id: Ia7cdbbed5e529864e751add6af05e5fc0be963e1
"}]
commit_message:
Add a warning for new mitaka releases of oslo.messaging

Neutron (and possibly others) were/are using a private symbol of
oslo.messaging  several reviews have been put in place to mitigate this
including a requirements change that bans
!=2.6.0,!=2.6.1,!=2.7.0,!=2.8.0,!=2.8.1,!=2.9.0 from liberty

If a new release is tagged in the range >2.6.0 <3.0.0 it will NOT be
banned and may introduce a regression.

A release in that range is doable but we need to be careful.  Add a
warning to that we don't forget and do that thing.

Depends-On: I5d15366a212c6ed21f33bfe011876fc2bb56997c
Change-Id: Ia7cdbbed5e529864e751add6af05e5fc0be963e1

commit_message:
Remove periods of docstring

Based on the desgin of openstack client, the docstring of each
function will be the help string for cli. Now all the other
services' commands don't use a period. So let's remove them
for zaqar to be consistent.

Change-Id: I9c8b18995c311d844a25c4a4da6be1aa6cc3790b

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-11-19 09:13:47.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/assignment/controllers.py', 'keystone/assignment/routers.py'], 'message': 'Rationalize list role assignment routing

The v3 role assignment controller was created as a standard
controller even though it only supports the list method. This means
not only do we have code stubs that are unused, but this will
complicate the addition of separate entry points for listing role
assignments for a tree in the follow on patch.

This patch, therfore, rationalizes the routes so that this
is set up for just the list method, and removes the unused code
stubs.

Implements: bp list-assignment-subtree
Change-Id: I0c03accecdcf1608b50ad6b130c8a49d8a9b5b42
'}]
commit_message:
Rationalize list role assignment routing

The v3 role assignment controller was created as a standard
controller even though it only supports the list method. This means
not only do we have code stubs that are unused, but this will
complicate the addition of separate entry points for listing role
assignments for a tree in the follow on patch.

This patch, therfore, rationalizes the routes so that this
is set up for just the list method, and removes the unused code
stubs.

Implements: bp list-assignment-subtree
Change-Id: I0c03accecdcf1608b50ad6b130c8a49d8a9b5b42

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-23 18:46:10.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/tests/etc/neutron.conf', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Disable automatic config file discovery for pep8 target

When trying to run pep8 target on a system with installed
/etc/neutron/neutron.conf file, neutron-db-manage may fail due to
access denied to the configuration file. This is because oslo.config
attempts to discover configuration files automatically if they are
not passed with --config-file argument.

To disable auto discovery, we pass --config-file to the tool.

Change-Id: I89b5cbae1fcbf662cba6bc724681d0cfeeb0eb9c
(cherry picked from commit ae573d11bcb27d8ae17ddb25794d2d3e5fdd4438)
'}]
commit_message:
Disable automatic config file discovery for pep8 target

When trying to run pep8 target on a system with installed
/etc/neutron/neutron.conf file, neutron-db-manage may fail due to
access denied to the configuration file. This is because oslo.config
attempts to discover configuration files automatically if they are
not passed with --config-file argument.

To disable auto discovery, we pass --config-file to the tool.

Change-Id: I89b5cbae1fcbf662cba6bc724681d0cfeeb0eb9c
(cherry picked from commit ae573d11bcb27d8ae17ddb25794d2d3e5fdd4438)

commit_message:
Unify on _schedule_instances

There's already a helper method for unshelve_instance. It turns out
that the other two places in this file which call select_destinations
can use the same helper. Doing this removes some code redundancy.

I haven't pushed build_request_spec in as well because for bp
check-destination-on-migrations we won't always be constructing a
brand new request spec.

Change-Id: I19bad96d997f61958e32f6254bc4a428395bc7ec

subject: Don't install unicodecsv on Python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-20 08:16:35.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Don't install unicodecsv on Python 3

On Python 3, the stdlib csv module handles well Unicode. There is no
need to use a third-party module for that.

Moreover, it looks like unicodecsv caused issues on Ubuntu with
Python 3.5 in the cliff library: see related bug.

Add also unicodecsv license.

Related-Bug: 1491888
Change-Id: Ie8fc1b00f4e76cfd5a81615d26ea7c05fdee7209
"}]
commit_message:
Don't install unicodecsv on Python 3

On Python 3, the stdlib csv module handles well Unicode. There is no
need to use a third-party module for that.

Moreover, it looks like unicodecsv caused issues on Ubuntu with
Python 3.5 in the cliff library: see related bug.

Add also unicodecsv license.

Related-Bug: 1491888
Change-Id: Ie8fc1b00f4e76cfd5a81615d26ea7c05fdee7209

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-20 14:25:51.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/opts.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add check_uptodate.sh --checkopts to "pep8"

2f9e416 Downstream Fix for Genconfig
  collided with
fb17ed8 Add -constraints for CI jobs

while merging and this only got added to
pep8-constraints.  It should be in "pep8" as well.

opts.py is updated here since it is out of sync,
due to this test not running.

Change-Id: I668df6be4301a052a4b47549c702a81b43abd8fc
'}]
commit_message:
Add check_uptodate.sh --checkopts to "pep8"

2f9e416 Downstream Fix for Genconfig
  collided with
fb17ed8 Add -constraints for CI jobs

while merging and this only got added to
pep8-constraints.  It should be in "pep8" as well.

opts.py is updated here since it is out of sync,
due to this test not running.

Change-Id: I668df6be4301a052a4b47549c702a81b43abd8fc

subject: Correctly determine when SSL termination config changes
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-23 22:10:46.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/rackspace/rackspace/tests/test_cloud_loadbalancer.py', 'contrib/rackspace/rackspace/resources/cloud_loadbalancer.py'], 'message': 'Correctly determine when SSL termination config changes

The Rackspace::Cloud::Loadbalancer resource does not diff
different versions of sslTermination config correctly, leading
it to be stuck in check_create_complete forever. This patch has
the required logic to make that check correctly.

Change-Id: I2fc3e9bf144f15a4bc48ad3996b8dde3338d361c
Closes-Bug: #1519069
'}]
commit_message:
Correctly determine when SSL termination config changes

The Rackspace::Cloud::Loadbalancer resource does not diff
different versions of sslTermination config correctly, leading
it to be stuck in check_create_complete forever. This patch has
the required logic to make that check correctly.

Change-Id: I2fc3e9bf144f15a4bc48ad3996b8dde3338d361c
Closes-Bug: #1519069

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-24 20:00:22.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': "Adding os-win to OpenStack

os-win is a library containing Windows / Hyper-V code commonly used in the
OpenStack projects: nova, cinder, ceilometer, networking-hyperv. The
library can be used in any other OpenStack projects where it is needed.

All code has been developed under an Apache 2.0 license and has no
restrictions on distribution or deployment. All os-win code is submitted
and reviewed through OpenStack Gerrit [1]. The os-win project maintains
a core team that approves all changes. Bugs are filed, reviewed and
tracked in Launchpad [4].

os-win integrates in several OpenStack projects and services. The project
uses Oslo libraries.

os-win was first informally proposed at the Nova Liberty mid-cycle meetup.
The project is standalone and it is not part of Oslo, as per Oslo's team
decision. [5]

The first major release of os-win will be tagged for Mitaka.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:open+os-win,n,z
[2]: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Os-win
[3]: https://github.com/openstack/os-win
[4]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/os-win
[5]:
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/oslo/2015/oslo.2015-08-17-16.00.log.html

Change-Id: Ib6f881b70bfeea68f264ec6f35a69befc55af823
"}]
commit_message:
Adding os-win to OpenStack

os-win is a library containing Windows / Hyper-V code commonly used in the
OpenStack projects: nova, cinder, ceilometer, networking-hyperv. The
library can be used in any other OpenStack projects where it is needed.

All code has been developed under an Apache 2.0 license and has no
restrictions on distribution or deployment. All os-win code is submitted
and reviewed through OpenStack Gerrit [1]. The os-win project maintains
a core team that approves all changes. Bugs are filed, reviewed and
tracked in Launchpad [4].

os-win integrates in several OpenStack projects and services. The project
uses Oslo libraries.

os-win was first informally proposed at the Nova Liberty mid-cycle meetup.
The project is standalone and it is not part of Oslo, as per Oslo's team
decision. [5]

The first major release of os-win will be tagged for Mitaka.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:open+os-win,n,z
[2]: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Os-win
[3]: https://github.com/openstack/os-win
[4]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/os-win
[5]:
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/oslo/2015/oslo.2015-08-17-16.00.log.html

Change-Id: Ib6f881b70bfeea68f264ec6f35a69befc55af823

commit_message:
Reverse-listings follow-up

 * With the end_prefix changes in the original commit, we no longer need
   the `or not name.startswith(prefix)` check.
 * Improve test coverage of reverse path listings.

Change-Id: Iaa7d4b83647c3c150be95f88cb3cc9e4f0e33979

Change-Id: Iaa3ba81a7e9cae09cea153720b29879d8cc9a080

commit_message:
Make Neutron resources reference standard attr table

This adds a new 'standardattributes' table and adds a foreign-key
references from ports, subnets, networks, subnetpools, routers,
securitygroups, and floatingips to this table.

This will make it easy to add new things to the schema like
timestamp fields or anything else that applies to multiple types
of Neutron resources. The new fields would just be added to the
'neutronresources' table instead of being duplicated across each
resource's table. Or, if the the relationship is 1-to-many (e.g. tags),
the new association table would be related to the 'standardattribute'
table.

Related-Bug: #1496802
Change-Id: Iaa3ba81a7e9cae09cea153720b29879d8cc9a080

subject: Retry API calls if they get a Retryable failure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-24 16:19:33.000000000', 'files': ['shade/task_manager.py'], 'message': "Retry API calls if they get a Retryable failure

keystoneauth1 Session throws exceptions based on
RetriableConnectionFailure when the operation can be sanely retried.
Since we have commuication encapsulated, there is no reason to not
just retry.

We should maybe in the future allow for configuration of number of
times to retry - but let's start with one and go from there.

Change-Id: Iacc6ac3d7eecbccfa7602fefb238602cc8a66cc4
"}]
commit_message:
Retry API calls if they get a Retryable failure

keystoneauth1 Session throws exceptions based on
RetriableConnectionFailure when the operation can be sanely retried.
Since we have commuication encapsulated, there is no reason to not
just retry.

We should maybe in the future allow for configuration of number of
times to retry - but let's start with one and go from there.

Change-Id: Iacc6ac3d7eecbccfa7602fefb238602cc8a66cc4

revisions:
[{'number': 20, 'created': '2015-11-14 00:33:42.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_auth/tests/tests.py', 'openstack_auth/views.py', 'openstack_auth/backend.py', 'openstack_auth/tests/data_v3.py', 'openstack_auth/utils.py'], 'message': "Add domain scoped token to session in multidomain

In order to perform identity operations in keystone v3 when the v3
policy file is used, a domain scoped token is required. Adding the
domain scoped token to the session as it remains valid until the user
logs out.

The domain scoped token is sizeable, so a check to make sure the
session backend used is not signed cookies, as this will overflow
the cookie.

Additionally, errors around getting and storing the domain scoped
token are logged, but doesn't block authentication, as it only blocks
identity operations.

A call to delete the domain token is made on logout.

Support for the case of a user with a domain role but no project roles
is now supported as well. That is a user can log in with only scoping
to a domain. This allows domain admins to be able to configure identity
without requiring a project role.

Implements: blueprint domain-scoped-tokens
Change-Id: I0ed1737cdd80dc143f1df94700e311351d5d3b24
"}]
commit_message:
Add domain scoped token to session in multidomain

In order to perform identity operations in keystone v3 when the v3
policy file is used, a domain scoped token is required. Adding the
domain scoped token to the session as it remains valid until the user
logs out.

The domain scoped token is sizeable, so a check to make sure the
session backend used is not signed cookies, as this will overflow
the cookie.

Additionally, errors around getting and storing the domain scoped
token are logged, but doesn't block authentication, as it only blocks
identity operations.

A call to delete the domain token is made on logout.

Support for the case of a user with a domain role but no project roles
is now supported as well. That is a user can log in with only scoping
to a domain. This allows domain admins to be able to configure identity
without requiring a project role.

Implements: blueprint domain-scoped-tokens
Change-Id: I0ed1737cdd80dc143f1df94700e311351d5d3b24

commit_message:
Handle NO_DOMAIN status

Previous to this patch, when MiniDNS got a `NO_DOMAIN` status back,
it didn't do anything to handle it. Domains just hung in ERROR.

closes-bug: #1416264
(cherry picked from commit ed2861a0193e2b5ebbb89a8d8fb04fdded976483)

Conflicts:
	designate/tests/unit/test_central/test_basic.py

Change-Id: I4348f714868f38c2549c516fe83cce608c0c8d59

subject: Block oslo.messaging 2.6.0->2.9.0 in Liberty
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-23 20:34:07.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': "Block oslo.messaging 2.6.0->2.9.0 in Liberty

2.6.0 changed module names for notification drivers in change:

1893c495f6e9ba53c7d93ad99f679f44f66837ef

This broke Neutron's notification system (and maybe other projects).

Paths were updated in Neutron for Mitaka in change:

225663888e71d44e9732951f515da925b8799b74

And a minimum set on oslo.messaging in mitaka g-r.

To fix Neutron in stable/liberty, oslo.messaging now has an alias for
the older messaging driver paths:

15cd99050c6d2714b90059e0faad9f9e3409eaaa

This is released in oslo.messaging 3.0.0. So we need to block all
oslo.messaging releases that don't have the internal driver paths, which
is all releases between 2.6.0 and 2.9.0.

Depends-On: I9f3c2e391f810927c5b9b541213655030a464c24

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem@us.ibm.com>

Closes-Bug: #1513630

Change-Id: I5d15366a212c6ed21f33bfe011876fc2bb56997c
"}]
commit_message:
Block oslo.messaging 2.6.0->2.9.0 in Liberty

2.6.0 changed module names for notification drivers in change:

1893c495f6e9ba53c7d93ad99f679f44f66837ef

This broke Neutron's notification system (and maybe other projects).

Paths were updated in Neutron for Mitaka in change:

225663888e71d44e9732951f515da925b8799b74

And a minimum set on oslo.messaging in mitaka g-r.

To fix Neutron in stable/liberty, oslo.messaging now has an alias for
the older messaging driver paths:

15cd99050c6d2714b90059e0faad9f9e3409eaaa

This is released in oslo.messaging 3.0.0. So we need to block all
oslo.messaging releases that don't have the internal driver paths, which
is all releases between 2.6.0 and 2.9.0.

Depends-On: I9f3c2e391f810927c5b9b541213655030a464c24

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem@us.ibm.com>

Closes-Bug: #1513630

Change-Id: I5d15366a212c6ed21f33bfe011876fc2bb56997c

subject: don't pass aodh options to oslo.db engine facade
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-16 18:15:46.000000000', 'files': ['aodh/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': "don't pass aodh options to oslo.db engine facade

oslo.db EngineFacade class only support options defined by oslo.db,
but we also pass options defined by aodh, so oslo.db complains
with a warning message:

NotSupportedWarning: Configuration option(s) ['alarm_connection', \
'alarm_history_time_to_live'] not supported

This patch makes sure only options defined by oslo.db will be sent
to EngineFacade

Change-Id: I4c259f29af1cab60c3aee41a610b12f64ed5f2d5
Closes-Bug: #1516515
"}]
commit_message:
don't pass aodh options to oslo.db engine facade

oslo.db EngineFacade class only support options defined by oslo.db,
but we also pass options defined by aodh, so oslo.db complains
with a warning message:

NotSupportedWarning: Configuration option(s) ['alarm_connection', \
'alarm_history_time_to_live'] not supported

This patch makes sure only options defined by oslo.db will be sent
to EngineFacade

Change-Id: I4c259f29af1cab60c3aee41a610b12f64ed5f2d5
Closes-Bug: #1516515

commit_message:
docs: describe migration and other movement concepts

Migration (including cold and live migration), resize and shelve
are three concepts at the API level that support three distinct
sets of use cases. These all involve movement of servers and
so provide opportunity for operational efficiency.

This patch adds a section to the server concepts that outlines
the purpose behind the actions and the operational efficiencies
that can be gained by them.

blueprint complete-todo-in-api-concept-doc

Change-Id: I6b9c6c179c1bdd9400abae7deb1918b370ddaefd

subject: Make acl_scenarios tests' keystonemiddleware cache work flexibly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-24 15:16:18.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_acl_scenarios.py'], 'message': "Make acl_scenarios tests' keystonemiddleware cache work flexibly

Token cache keys in keystonemiddleware 2.0 are sha256 hashes of the
token key. This is _not_ the case in keystonemiddleware <2.0. This
change adjusts the FakeMemcache to support both types of key.

Closes-Bug: #1519382
Change-Id: Idcba48b227e8921a67f5af27f723810704ae790b
(cherry picked from commit 41d2cc9bf2f87fcb24de05e71a879ab7a7829409)
"}]
commit_message:
Make acl_scenarios tests' keystonemiddleware cache work flexibly

Token cache keys in keystonemiddleware 2.0 are sha256 hashes of the
token key. This is _not_ the case in keystonemiddleware <2.0. This
change adjusts the FakeMemcache to support both types of key.

Closes-Bug: #1519382
Change-Id: Idcba48b227e8921a67f5af27f723810704ae790b
(cherry picked from commit 41d2cc9bf2f87fcb24de05e71a879ab7a7829409)

subject: Top and Bottom Padding should be removed from navbar-brand
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-11-24 15:20:46.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/scss/components/_navbar.scss', 'openstack_dashboard/themes/default/bootstrap/components/_navbar.scss'], 'message': "Top and Bottom Padding should be removed from navbar-brand

When using a theme other than 'default', a custom logo that is too
big won't be sized to fit inside of the header exactly perfectly.
The 'default' theme does this.  The style just needs to be moved
outside of 'default' theme to be global.

Change-Id: I241e49ad94cba24592209f5f4f23eedeb0e592a6
Closes-Bug: #1518123
"}]
commit_message:
Top and Bottom Padding should be removed from navbar-brand

When using a theme other than 'default', a custom logo that is too
big won't be sized to fit inside of the header exactly perfectly.
The 'default' theme does this.  The style just needs to be moved
outside of 'default' theme to be global.

Change-Id: I241e49ad94cba24592209f5f4f23eedeb0e592a6
Closes-Bug: #1518123

commit_message:
Move get_by_id to CinderObject

Currently each Versioned Object needs to implement its own get_by_id,
with this patch they don't need anymore, since it will be included in
the base class CinderObject and it will work for all the objects.

This will help for other things like having a refresh method or
conditional updates in the objects.

Related-Bug: #1490944
Related-Bug: #1238093
Related-Bug: #1490946
Related-Bug: #1469659
Change-Id: I355dc8eaefed93003533ee083f74acd1315f057e

Remove example extension

we will no longer be supporting extensions, everything is in keystone
proper, with varying degrees of stability.

Implements: bp move-extensions
Closes-Bug: #1519244

This change adds the ability to tell the container or account server to
reverse their listings. This is done by sending a reverse=TRUE_VALUE,

Where TRUE_VALUE is one of the values true can be in common/utils:

  TRUE_VALUES = set(('true', '1', 'yes', 'on', 't', 'y'))

For example:

  curl -i -X GET -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" $STORAGE_URL/c/?reverse=on

I borrowed the swapping of the markers code from Kevin's old change,
thanks Kevin. And Tim Burke added some real nuggets of awesomeness.

Change-Id: I5eb655360ac95042877da26d18707aebc11c02f6
'}]
commit_message:
Add container and account reverse listings

This change adds the ability to tell the container or account server to
reverse their listings. This is done by sending a reverse=TRUE_VALUE,

Where TRUE_VALUE is one of the values true can be in common/utils:

  TRUE_VALUES = set(('true', '1', 'yes', 'on', 't', 'y'))

For example:

  curl -i -X GET -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" $STORAGE_URL/c/?reverse=on

I borrowed the swapping of the markers code from Kevin's old change,
thanks Kevin. And Tim Burke added some real nuggets of awesomeness.

DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Kevin McDonald <kmcdonald@softlayer.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>
Implements: blueprint reverse-object-listing

Change-Id: I5eb655360ac95042877da26d18707aebc11c02f6

subject: Copy the env to the backup stack in failed update
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-19 19:57:16.000000000', 'files': ['heat_integrationtests/functional/test_create_update.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py'], 'message': "Copy the env to the backup stack in failed update

When an update fails, we currently update the environment of the stack
to contain both the new and old parameters and types. Unfortunately we
don't do that for the backup stack which is reused. This patch adds the
environment change.

Change-Id: I4dc5dd35e4aeee498dd8960a1000913e97b924d5
Closes-Bug: 1508096
(cherry picked from commit 88da460316e2c18b3ceb58f51dcf0bda717a18a3
                       and 13c68910704844719b2d3de353d2db276377bf11)
"}]
commit_message:
Copy the env to the backup stack in failed update

When an update fails, we currently update the environment of the stack
to contain both the new and old parameters and types. Unfortunately we
don't do that for the backup stack which is reused. This patch adds the
environment change.

Change-Id: I4dc5dd35e4aeee498dd8960a1000913e97b924d5
Closes-Bug: 1508096
(cherry picked from commit 88da460316e2c18b3ceb58f51dcf0bda717a18a3
                       and 13c68910704844719b2d3de353d2db276377bf11)

revisions:

This commit adds a spec for a group of changes that will rework
how Bandit deals with config.  The approach will remove unused
options, move profiles to separate purpose-built files, and use
sensible defaults for plugins when possible.

Change-Id: I2a65d799466650a76b41ec6ecd748ef5156f57b7
'}]
commit_message:
Add Bandit Config Change Spec

This commit adds a spec for a group of changes that will rework
how Bandit deals with config.  The approach will remove unused
options, move profiles to separate purpose-built files, and use
sensible defaults for plugins when possible.

Change-Id: I2a65d799466650a76b41ec6ecd748ef5156f57b7

Remove eventlet usage

This removes entirely our usage of eventlet and its ugly monkey-patching
in favor of a threaded approach.

commit_message:
Flip Neutron's unit tests to -constraints

This flips master and stable/liberty to use -constraints unit tests as
voting.  The unconstrained jobs are dropped from master and liberty.

Implements Blueprint: Requirements-Management

Change-Id: I152ed78813e46ffc3f72ff7dec5ed2872268f5bd

commit_message:
Add T111 hacking rule for consistent DELETE method

As the consistent-service-method-names bp, "DELETE /resources/<id>"
methods' names should be "delete_<resource name>".
So this patch adds it as the hacking rule.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I36592a91001361d816e302745fe8417aee5e7565

tempest-lib- I80c6e148ae30148e591d24675fe068c829a0867a

from Tempest-lib.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-10 16:37:46.000000000', 'files': ['tools/tox_install.sh'], 'message': 'Set ZUUL_BRANCH using BRANCH if not available

In most cases, ZUUL_BRANCH is set in gate, but not all the time. One
exception is e.g. periodic stable jobs, where there is no actual patch
to validate, hence no ZUUL_REF or ZUUL_BRANCH is set. In that case, we
need to help zuul-cloner to determine the proper branch to fetch
neutron.

It could be achieved by e.g. hardcoding the branch using --zuul_branch
CLI argument passed into zuul-cloner. In this patch, I instead set

This fixes the issue for stable/liberty periodic jobs for neutron-lbaas
when we tried to validate it against neutron/master.

Change-Id: I360239a1443f8d4e16210a1ef743912e1bf85f41
(cherry picked from commit d103c031569b66fcc92a724d1f31e8a1615b29e5)
'}]
commit_message:
Set ZUUL_BRANCH using BRANCH if not available

In most cases, ZUUL_BRANCH is set in gate, but not all the time. One
exception is e.g. periodic stable jobs, where there is no actual patch
to validate, hence no ZUUL_REF or ZUUL_BRANCH is set. In that case, we
need to help zuul-cloner to determine the proper branch to fetch
neutron.

It could be achieved by e.g. hardcoding the branch using --zuul_branch
CLI argument passed into zuul-cloner. In this patch, I instead set
ZUUL_BRANCH to BRANCH that seems to be always present in all kinds of
jobs. It is then used by zuul-cloner to choose the correct branch.

This fixes the issue for stable/liberty periodic jobs for neutron-lbaas
when we tried to validate it against neutron/master.

Change-Id: I360239a1443f8d4e16210a1ef743912e1bf85f41
(cherry picked from commit d103c031569b66fcc92a724d1f31e8a1615b29e5)

commit_message:
use last specified value for duplicate dimension

When user specifies a dimension for multiple times, monasca_manager
cannot generate dimension url, because it expects a string but gets
a list. For such case, we should use the last specified value.

Change-Id: Ic90447fabf7a00d034ba4c423fea34c30da222e7
Closes-Bug: #1518664

subject: Tweak the way plugin attributes are loaded
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-23 23:13:13.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/tests/unit/loading/test_loading.py', 'keystoneauth1/loading/base.py'], 'message': 'Tweak the way plugin attributes are loaded

By using the setdefault method to add plugin parameters to the kwargs
passed to load_from_options() we are unnecessarily calling the getter
function when the value may not be saved.

This has generally not been a problem however if we start doing things
like prompting users for a password in the getter this is an expensive
and disruptive operation for a parameter that may not be stored.

Change-Id: Ic8dc3a425662c4a89372f178b175b8caab44e024
'}]
commit_message:
Tweak the way plugin attributes are loaded

By using the setdefault method to add plugin parameters to the kwargs
passed to load_from_options() we are unnecessarily calling the getter
function when the value may not be saved.

This has generally not been a problem however if we start doing things
like prompting users for a password in the getter this is an expensive
and disruptive operation for a parameter that may not be stored.

Change-Id: Ic8dc3a425662c4a89372f178b175b8caab44e024

commit_message:
Change tests to adapt alarm spliting

Currently, alarm module has been diceded to be splitted out from
Ceilometer tree, named as aodh. This change make tests adapt to the
spliting.

NOTE: This change temporarily set the aodh service availability config
option as False, it is mainly because the alarming service spliting
change[1] need to be merged now. I will enable aodh in tempest and
make it works by another change.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/197161/

Closes-Bug: #1509885

commit_message:
Add load_from_options_getter to plugin loading

Loading from getter function was introduced into keystoneclient as a way
to enable OCC and auth_token middleware to define more unusual loading
mechanisms.

It was skipped in the move to keystoneauth. This adds it back.

Closes-Bug: #1514339
Change-Id: I1d464917e0ddec8e13f9395ad75db6ccc53cb813

This patch is adding a configuration option to the drivers called
"power_off_deploy_fail", by default the value is True and it will power

will put the node in maintenance mode and will not call power off. The
option is specially useful when used with the IPA ramdisk, since it allows

commit_message:
Troubleshoot: Do not power off node if deployment fails

This patch is adding a configuration option to the drivers called
"power_off_deploy_fail", by default the value is True and it will power
off the node when deployment fails (just like today). If set to False it
will put the node in maintenance mode and will not call power off. The
option is specially useful when used with the IPA ramdisk, since it allows
operators to SSH into it and check the deployment logs to try to figure
out why it failed, and for that we need to keep the node powered on.

Closes-Bug: #1443374
Depends-On: Ifb69fddd0a595a4b9fceee37841a132c23c24968
Change-Id: Ie17dba05435248c9161737f93b3c4d87d0259002

commit_message:
remove Python 2.6-specific logging workaround

0ff39c14 (December 2013) introduced this LoggingHandlerWeakRef to work
around a problem in which file descriptors would be leaked under Python
2.6. But we don't support 2.6 anymore.

Change-Id: I1cd8249dfe17bce9cb301d13b761c11d2efd11d3

There are 10 test cases which is skipped when we run mysql functional

commit_message:
fix some test cases wrongly skipped for mysql backend

There are 10 test cases which is skipped when we run mysql functional
test, because they are decorated by run_with(), which expects to be
handled by engine mysql, but gets engine mysql+pymysql.

This patch maps engine mysql+pymysql to mysql to enable these tests.

Change-Id: Ief0646b6ca66e514300cbc93d3e5e66b0573b590
Closes-Bug: #1519211

commit_message:
gnocchi: only evaluate the required eval_periods

The threshold evaluator retrieves one more evaluation_periods
from the backend via _statistic() and assumes _sanitize()
pick up only correct number of evaluation periods.

This fixes the gnocchi threshold evaluator to return
the correct number of evaluation periods.

Related-bug: #1506911
Related-bug: #1513092
Change-Id: Ic010d54d9e7c42d6d846fe76812cd0c0e5f0835e

Particularly for allowing the CLI to store and reuse previous
authentication allow an application to extract and reinstall the
auth state from a plugin.

to uniquely identify the plugin.

We then have a get_auth_state and set_auth_state function, the return of
which is intended to be opaque to the calling application. If the plugin
created returns an ID of an existing authentication you can call

'}]
commit_message:
Allow saving and caching the plugin auth state

Particularly for allowing the CLI to store and reuse previous
authentication allow an application to extract and reinstall the
auth state from a plugin.

We provide a method that returns a dictionary of all of the identifiable
information that is used to create a plugin. This dictionary is hashed
to uniquely identify the plugin.

We then have a get_auth_state and set_auth_state function, the return of
which is intended to be opaque to the calling application. If the plugin
created returns an ID of an existing authentication you can call
set_auth_state to load that state. If the state is out of date it will
be refreshed as per normal otherwise it will be used instead of
authenticating again.

There is not support for caching federated tokens in this patch. They
will follow the exact same pattern and are not much harder they just
need a way for subclasses to signal they are cachable and so can be done
as a follow up.

Implements: bp cachable-auth
Change-Id: I4eebe7ff8060a37f19af5decfa3a8313cfb7c207

commit_message:
Reduced the complexity of the __init__ method

The get_events method is very large - almost 100 lines
(in ceilometer/api/controllers/v2/query.py).
I extracted some of the functionalities into helper functions
to reduce the length and complexity of __init__.
Additionally it became more readable as well, without
changing its functionality.

subject: remove unnecessary mock for rpc server start
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-24 13:38:53.000000000', 'files': ['aodh/tests/unit/test_notifier.py'], 'message': "remove unnecessary mock for rpc server start

latest oslo.messaging 3.0.0 requires invoking start() first then stop()
can be called, but we've mocked the start() which will hang the process
then finally raise TimeoutException.

Change-Id: I5a0e01cac52f9bf313bd06682660ff470b267c0c
Co-Authored-By: ZhiQiang Fan <aji.zqfan@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1519182
"}]
commit_message:
remove unnecessary mock for rpc server start

latest oslo.messaging 3.0.0 requires invoking start() first then stop()
can be called, but we've mocked the start() which will hang the process
then finally raise TimeoutException.

Change-Id: I5a0e01cac52f9bf313bd06682660ff470b267c0c
Co-Authored-By: ZhiQiang Fan <aji.zqfan@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1519182

commit_message:
Fixed incorrect name of 'tag' and 'tag-any' filters

According to spec
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/mitaka/approved/tag-instances.html
these filters should be named 'tags' and 'tags-any'.

Closes-Bug: #1506786

commit_message:
[install] changed the note because it restarts two services

The current note says that only Apache HTTP service is
restarted by systemd command. However, the command actually
restarts both Apache HTTP service and memcached service.
Therefore, the note should be changed that the command restarts
each service.

Change-Id: Ie11da97213103d3b740cfce7c5e4a08aa5d48294
Partial-Bug: #1467994

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-02 15:25:01.000000000', 'files': ['lib/cinder_backends/solidfire', 'lib/cinder_backends/netapp_nfs', 'lib/cinder_backends/netapp_iscsi', 'lib/cinder_backends/vmdk', 'lib/cinder_backends/xiv'], 'message': "Remove closed source cinder backends

If we want to encourage people to use externally hosted plugins for devstack
we should make no exception.

Cleaning up devstack was discussed at Vancouver (see
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-QA-Devstack-Roadmap)

I don't want to be hard on the competition here, but people are confused. (see
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/186807/ and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/177677/)

Change-Id: I07502173a8c6941d463615f6d7e2d057b98a17e0
"}]
commit_message:
Remove closed source cinder backends

If we want to encourage people to use externally hosted plugins for devstack
we should make no exception.

Cleaning up devstack was discussed at Vancouver (see
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-QA-Devstack-Roadmap)

I don't want to be hard on the competition here, but people are confused. (see
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/186807/ and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/177677/)

Change-Id: I07502173a8c6941d463615f6d7e2d057b98a17e0

subject: Ensure designate-manage reads config before policy
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-24 13:42:03.000000000', 'files': ['designate/manage/akamai.py', 'designate/manage/base.py'], 'message': 'Ensure designate-manage reads config before policy

With the designate-manage command, the policy file is read before
the configuration is parsed.

If the policy file is in a non-default location, all designate-manage
commands would fail.

Change-Id: Ic1e37c18cc61732db8df0d59cdb687b0167d63c0
Closes-Bug: 1519356
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure designate-manage reads config before policy

With the designate-manage command, the policy file is read before
the configuration is parsed.

If the policy file is in a non-default location, all designate-manage
commands would fail.

Change-Id: Ic1e37c18cc61732db8df0d59cdb687b0167d63c0
Closes-Bug: 1519356

subject: Ensure designate-manage reads config before policy
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-24 13:24:28.000000000', 'files': ['designate/manage/akamai.py', 'designate/manage/base.py'], 'message': 'Ensure designate-manage reads config before policy

With the designate-manage command, the policy file is read before
the configuration is parsed.

If the policy file is in a non-default location, all designate-manage
commands would fail.

Change-Id: Ic1e37c18cc61732db8df0d59cdb687b0167d63c0
Closes-Bug: 1519356
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure designate-manage reads config before policy

With the designate-manage command, the policy file is read before
the configuration is parsed.

If the policy file is in a non-default location, all designate-manage
commands would fail.

Change-Id: Ic1e37c18cc61732db8df0d59cdb687b0167d63c0
Closes-Bug: 1519356

subject: Fix race condition in V1 Records API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-24 17:35:32.000000000', 'files': ['designate/tests/test_api/test_v1/test_records.py', 'designate/api/v1/records.py'], 'message': 'Fix race condition in V1 Records API

When listing records in the V1 API, two calls to central
are made - once for records once for recordsets - if the
content of either changes between the two calls, a failure
can occour. Instead, we already have all the data we need
so use it from the recordsets rather than make two calls

Change-Id: Ic43d7e8c0d60267ec4788b63ed5f7e88e7bbe625
Closes-Bug: 1487934
(cherry picked from commit eea5c1e8ad55d7ec17bf4695ba63efbc0e170784)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition in V1 Records API

When listing records in the V1 API, two calls to central
are made - once for records once for recordsets - if the
content of either changes between the two calls, a failure
can occour. Instead, we already have all the data we need
so use it from the recordsets rather than make two calls

Change-Id: Ic43d7e8c0d60267ec4788b63ed5f7e88e7bbe625
Closes-Bug: 1487934
(cherry picked from commit eea5c1e8ad55d7ec17bf4695ba63efbc0e170784)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-24 14:36:23.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchiclient/v1/resource.py'], 'message': "Fixed history parameter having no effect on search

The history parameter wasn't passed to _get_pagination_options.
_get_pagination_options was adding a ? to the generated url parameters,
but the search was already doing it.

Change-Id: Id98dae88a090c14111eb3c9f31e41c10d9fc8fd1
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed history parameter having no effect on search

The history parameter wasn't passed to _get_pagination_options.
_get_pagination_options was adding a ? to the generated url parameters,
but the search was already doing it.

Change-Id: Id98dae88a090c14111eb3c9f31e41c10d9fc8fd1

revisions:

commit_message:
test stable gnocchi branch

currently, the integration test will always test against
gnocchi-master. this means the gnocchi-stable branches are never tested.
this changes integration test to test the appropriate gnocchi-stable
branch corresponding to the stable releases of ceilometer and aodh.
with each gnocchi-stable release, the corresponding ceilometer|aodh
stable target may need to be adjusted.

Change-Id: I0d78d2268b87a5aaaae21b6d8712003b2e990417

subject: Set puppet DIB_INSTALLTYPE in tripleo.sh not toci_instack.sh
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 1926, 'name': 'Derek Higgins', 'email': 'derekh@redhat.com', 'username': 'derekh'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-11-23 13:32:10.000000000', 'files': ['toci_instack.sh'], 'message': "Set puppet DIB_INSTALLTYPE in tripleo.sh not toci_instack.sh

Currently we override the puppet modules to build from source for CI
but that leads to tripleo.sh being broken for developers wanting to
set up a local environment matching what's in CI.

So, instead rely on tripleo.sh to setup the right version based on
the branch (e.g master or stable/liberty based on STABLE_RELEASE)

We still set up puppet.env so the DIB_REPOREF data is setup correctly
when we depend on an under-review puppet change.

This depends on the https://review.openstack.org/#/c/246447/ change to
tripleo.sh (merged for master tripleo-common), not using
Depends-On or this change will be blocked on the (not merged) liberty
patch.

Change-Id: Ia7615d7f6293e4a220e0121dbb5ea095b3bb5275
"}]
commit_message:
Set puppet DIB_INSTALLTYPE in tripleo.sh not toci_instack.sh

Currently we override the puppet modules to build from source for CI
but that leads to tripleo.sh being broken for developers wanting to
set up a local environment matching what's in CI.

So, instead rely on tripleo.sh to setup the right version based on
the branch (e.g master or stable/liberty based on STABLE_RELEASE)

We still set up puppet.env so the DIB_REPOREF data is setup correctly
when we depend on an under-review puppet change.

This depends on the https://review.openstack.org/#/c/246447/ change to
tripleo.sh (merged for master tripleo-common), not using
Depends-On or this change will be blocked on the (not merged) liberty
patch.

Change-Id: Ia7615d7f6293e4a220e0121dbb5ea095b3bb5275

commit_message:
[contributor] Change RST inline markup conventions

:program:` ` markup is not widely used at our docs.
This convention become an inconsistency.
Also, this markup doesn't help translators.

Some discussion on docs mailing list:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-docs/2015-November/007892.html

Change-Id: I7efd24efc626ebfc5d73a2f23a1ee5e7ddfc00a4

subject: Keystone_endpoint match service by name/type.
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2015-11-23 10:30:43.000000000', 'files': ['spec/acceptance/basic_keystone_spec.rb', 'spec/unit/provider/keystone_endpoint/openstack_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_endpoint/openstack.rb', 'spec/unit/type/keystone_endpoint_spec.rb', 'spec/acceptance/keystone_wsgi_apache_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet_x/keystone/type/required.rb', 'README.md', 'lib/puppet/type/keystone_endpoint.rb'], 'message': 'Keystone_endpoint match service by name/type.

This enable keystone_endpoint to specify the type of the service
matched.  This way one can match services which are different only by
type and not only by name, like services nova/compute and nova/computev3
for instance.  It does so by fetching the _id_ of the service when it
has the type information instead of just using the name.

This should be required, and deprecation has been added, as the current
code work only because of a convention.

Change-Id: I9ea20fbad274d583485bc09a52b9df8000eb1af5
Closes-Bug: #1506996
'}]
commit_message:
Keystone_endpoint match service by name/type.

This enable keystone_endpoint to specify the type of the service
matched.  This way one can match services which are different only by
type and not only by name, like services nova/compute and nova/computev3
for instance.  It does so by fetching the _id_ of the service when it
has the type information instead of just using the name.

This should be required, and deprecation has been added, as the current
code work only because of a convention.

Change-Id: I9ea20fbad274d583485bc09a52b9df8000eb1af5
Closes-Bug: #1506996

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-09 19:12:04.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'test/unit/common/test_storage_policy.py', 'test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'test/unit/__init__.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'etc/swift.conf-sample', 'test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_reconstructor.py'], 'message': "EC: Use ec_type=liberasurecode_rs_vand in unit tests

To minimize external library dependencies for Swift unit
tests and SAIO, PyECLib 1.1.1 introduces a native backend
'liberasurecode_rs_vand.'  This patch is to migrate over
the unit tests and swift.conf sample to the new ec_type.

This change ups the PyECLib requirement to >=1.0.7 as an
intermediate step to the upgrade to >=1.1.1:  Upper
constraint for CI is at ==1.0.7 at the moment and unless
Swift is updated to >=1.0.7, it (and global-requirements)
cannot be updated to >=1.1.1.

Related SAIO doc changes are part of a separate patch.

Change-Id: Idde727f855aeecc7da7570a4af3656af6bdbc779
"}]
commit_message:
EC: Use ec_type=liberasurecode_rs_vand in unit tests

To minimize external library dependencies for Swift unit
tests and SAIO, PyECLib 1.1.1 introduces a native backend
'liberasurecode_rs_vand.'  This patch is to migrate over
the unit tests and swift.conf sample to the new ec_type.

This change ups the PyECLib requirement to >=1.0.7 as an
intermediate step to the upgrade to >=1.1.1:  Upper
constraint for CI is at ==1.0.7 at the moment and unless
Swift is updated to >=1.0.7, it (and global-requirements)
cannot be updated to >=1.1.1.

Related SAIO doc changes are part of a separate patch.

Change-Id: Idde727f855aeecc7da7570a4af3656af6bdbc779

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-18 15:44:44.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/nova.rb'], 'message': "Add region support to nova providers

Nova providers did not previously have region support, so things like
the host aggregate provider do not work as expected in a multi-region
environment. This change mirrors what puppet-neutron's providers do,
they use the nova_region_name setting, this uses neutron/region_name.

Change-Id: I1d5bddbe977352b0458115ab77b8129311b63453
Closes-Bug: #1517220
"}]
commit_message:
Add region support to nova providers

Nova providers did not previously have region support, so things like
the host aggregate provider do not work as expected in a multi-region
environment. This change mirrors what puppet-neutron's providers do,
they use the nova_region_name setting, this uses neutron/region_name.

Change-Id: I1d5bddbe977352b0458115ab77b8129311b63453
Closes-Bug: #1517220

commit_message:
No longer support configuring keystone under eventlet

This change removes devstack support for deploying keystone under
eventlet. This change should be merged as soon as development for
Mitaka has started (the stable/liberty branch has been cut) on
devstack.

Change-Id: I023ccc649c7ce674931ad638c6dd0d4c38a31e19

subject: Make acl_scenarios tests' keystonemiddleware cache work flexibly
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-18 09:58:47.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_acl_scenarios.py'], 'message': "Make acl_scenarios tests' keystonemiddleware cache work flexibly

Token cache keys in keystonemiddleware 2.0 are sha256 hashes of the
token key. This is _not_ the case in keystonemiddleware <2.0. This
change adjusts the FakeMemcache to support both types of key.

Change-Id: Idcba48b227e8921a67f5af27f723810704ae790b
"}]
commit_message:
Make acl_scenarios tests' keystonemiddleware cache work flexibly

Token cache keys in keystonemiddleware 2.0 are sha256 hashes of the
token key. This is _not_ the case in keystonemiddleware <2.0. This
change adjusts the FakeMemcache to support both types of key.

Change-Id: Idcba48b227e8921a67f5af27f723810704ae790b

To support multinode we must now distribute our setup to multiple

commit_message:
Convert gate to Ansible setup

To support multinode we must now distribute our setup to multiple
hosts. Instead of making special rules for this, we are going to
convert our existing setup to Ansible. This way both setup proceedures
take place in the exact same fashion.

Partially-Implements: blueprint multinode-gate
Change-Id: I43ece298bba994e9b5083403ef3cf6d4245cda6d

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-08-20 14:42:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/xenapi/client/session.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_xenapi.py'], 'message': 'Xenapi: Handle missing aggregate metadata on startup

If the host added using aggregate function to slave host in
Xenserver environments, nova-compute does not start
because cannot get aggregate metadata information.

Co-authored-by: John Haan <yongiman@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Yoon Doyoul <ydoyeul@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Michael Still <mikal@stillhq.com>

Change-Id: Idc979d7b3a974f7f9f61e6cd3485bd7a7e0879ea
Closes-Bug: 1413475
'}]
commit_message:
Xenapi: Handle missing aggregate metadata on startup

If the host added using aggregate function to slave host in
Xenserver environments, nova-compute does not start
because cannot get aggregate metadata information.

Co-authored-by: John Haan <yongiman@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Yoon Doyoul <ydoyeul@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Michael Still <mikal@stillhq.com>

Change-Id: Idc979d7b3a974f7f9f61e6cd3485bd7a7e0879ea
Closes-Bug: 1413475

commit_message:
Migrate libvirt volumes

This spec proposes using built-in libvirt volume transfer
methods to transfer libvirt volumes between compute nodes,
in order to facilitate cold migrations and resizes.

Spec for blueprint migrate-libvirt-volumes

Depends-On: Idc8e919627e2e01c2fa4599f15c9e2de614f41c3

[{'number': 60, 'created': '2015-11-24 11:47:58.000000000', 'files': ['templates/shibboleth.conf.erb', 'examples/k2k_sp_shib.pp', 'spec/classes/keystone_federation_shibboleth.rb', 'manifests/federation/shibboleth.pp', 'spec/acceptance/keystone_federation_shibboleth_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Support for Keystone as Service Provider

This patch implements the class to configure Keystone
as a Service Provider. It covers only Keystone as SP
for K2K (Protocol is SAML and module is Shibboleth)

On Debian based systems:
1- Configure keystone.conf
2- Install Shibboleth
3- Reconfigure the selected Keystone VirtualHost on Apache.

On RedHat based systems:
1- Configure keystone.conf
2- Reconfigure the selected Keystone VirtualHost on Apache.
Note: Step 2 will only execute if the user have add the extra repository
or installed shibboleth.
(About the extra repository, see:
https://wiki.shibboleth.net/confluence/display/SHIB2/NativeSPLinuxRPMInstall)

Implements: blueprint enabling-federation
Change-Id: I32a1487c7674605124e6d0b182fe38ea4b58de87
'}]
commit_message:
Support for Keystone as Service Provider

This patch implements the class to configure Keystone
as a Service Provider. It covers only Keystone as SP
for K2K (Protocol is SAML and module is Shibboleth)

On Debian based systems:
1- Configure keystone.conf
2- Install Shibboleth
3- Reconfigure the selected Keystone VirtualHost on Apache.

On RedHat based systems:
1- Configure keystone.conf
2- Reconfigure the selected Keystone VirtualHost on Apache.
Note: Step 2 will only execute if the user have add the extra repository
or installed shibboleth.
(About the extra repository, see:
https://wiki.shibboleth.net/confluence/display/SHIB2/NativeSPLinuxRPMInstall)

Implements: blueprint enabling-federation
Change-Id: I32a1487c7674605124e6d0b182fe38ea4b58de87

commit_message:
xen: mask passwords in volume connection_data dict

The connection_data dict can have credentials in it, so we need to scrub
those before putting the stringified dict into the StorageError message
and raising that up and when logging the dict.

Note that strutils.mask_password converts the dict to a string using
six.text_type so we don't have to do that conversion first.

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Ic5f4d4c26794550a92481bf2b725ef5eafa581b2
Closes-Bug: #1516765
(cherry picked from commit 8b289237ed6d53738c22878decf0c429301cf3d0)

commit_message:
Enable update of network properties for nova server profile

This patch adds support for network properties update for
os.nova.server profile type. To update the network definition
of a nova server cluster/node, user can create a new profile instance
with 'networks' spec property changed and then use this new profile
to update cluster/node.

Change-Id: I9f4c8143b543fd689e4c095175753ed353aaa494
Implements: blueprint support-nova-server-update

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-23 11:11:11.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/dev/dev-quickstart.rst'], 'message': "Drop some outdated information from our quick start guide

* Only tox has to be installed via pip, everything else is in virtual
  environment. Nose is no longer used.
* One should NOT run other tox commands in an existing tox environment.
  This is not how tox is intended to be used, and it cause weird failures
  or seemingly random virtual environment rebuilds.
* Drop statement about running unit tests on a clear VM. Not sure where it
  comes from, only tox and setuptools are required to run unit tests,
  and they don't mess with system packages. Only leave note about devstack,
  as people seem to have problems with it.

Change-Id: Ie7d0172b66231cfd8f9c4f8f2d76604a187443b0
"}]
commit_message:
Drop some outdated information from our quick start guide

* Only tox has to be installed via pip, everything else is in virtual
  environment. Nose is no longer used.
* One should NOT run other tox commands in an existing tox environment.
  This is not how tox is intended to be used, and it cause weird failures
  or seemingly random virtual environment rebuilds.
* Drop statement about running unit tests on a clear VM. Not sure where it
  comes from, only tox and setuptools are required to run unit tests,
  and they don't mess with system packages. Only leave note about devstack,
  as people seem to have problems with it.

Change-Id: Ie7d0172b66231cfd8f9c4f8f2d76604a187443b0

subject: Implement OpenStack client clouds.yml configuration file
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-24 03:15:12.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/openstack_openrc/templates/clouds.yml', 'playbooks/roles/openstack_openrc/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/openstack_openrc/tasks/main.yml'], 'message': 'Implement OpenStack client clouds.yml configuration file

OpenStack client supports defining one or more sets of credentials
inside a clouds.yml configuration file. A default configuration has
been created named `default` that contains the same admin credentials
from the `openrc` file currently being templated.

The default configuration can be specified using the following:

openstack --os-cloud default <command>

Change-Id: I62ac6fad7165cb07c551cdcf503e50ccd3cd3a56
'}]
commit_message:
Implement OpenStack client clouds.yml configuration file

OpenStack client supports defining one or more sets of credentials
inside a clouds.yml configuration file. A default configuration has
been created named `default` that contains the same admin credentials
from the `openrc` file currently being templated.

The default configuration can be specified using the following:

openstack --os-cloud default <command>

Change-Id: I62ac6fad7165cb07c551cdcf503e50ccd3cd3a56

subject: Fix HTTP error codes due to invalid templates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-21 02:57:32.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/api/openstack_v1/test_stacks.py', 'heat/engine/environment.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/resource_group.py', 'heat/tests/test_provider_template.py', 'heat/tests/engine/test_resource_type.py', 'heat/engine/resources/template_resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack_resource.py', 'heat/engine/service.py', 'heat/tests/test_resource.py', 'heat/api/middleware/fault.py', 'heat/common/exception.py', 'heat/tests/test_resource_group.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': 'Fix HTTP error codes due to invalid templates

This reverts commit 9a4d719ea1a6ca63f527b5c78308fd288058d42b and creates a
new exception type, InvalidGlobalResource, that is raised when a
non-existent template is referenced in the global environment and which
results in an HTTP 500 error.

This fixes the cases where we could return 404 or 500 errors as a result of
template validation failures, when we should return a 400 error.

Change-Id: I3c7b3182957448bb13514696cc2e12f5aaddd253
Closes-Bug: #1518458
Related-Bug: #1447194
'}]
commit_message:
Fix HTTP error codes due to invalid templates

This reverts commit 9a4d719ea1a6ca63f527b5c78308fd288058d42b and creates a
new exception type, InvalidGlobalResource, that is raised when a
non-existent template is referenced in the global environment and which
results in an HTTP 500 error.

This fixes the cases where we could return 404 or 500 errors as a result of
template validation failures, when we should return a 400 error.

Change-Id: I3c7b3182957448bb13514696cc2e12f5aaddd253
Closes-Bug: #1518458
Related-Bug: #1447194

commit_message:
Refactor the test for Fuel Master migration

Refactor the test to use template based approach:
- refactor the test to use template driven engine;
- add a new nodes config - 1 controller + 1 compute;
- add 2 new test configs - for VLAN and VXLAN net. providers
that use the new '1 controller + 1 compute' nodes config.

Change-Id: I586103f144bab73aa69b4239944ddf128919202b
Closes-bug: #1512677

subject: remove unnecessary mock for rpc server start
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-24 03:57:33.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'aodh/tests/unit/test_notifier.py'], 'message': "remove unnecessary mock for rpc server start

latest oslo.messaging 3.0.0 requires invoking start() first then stop()
can be called, but we've mocked the start() which will hang the process
then finally raise TimeoutException.

This patch removes unnecessary mock for rpc server start(), and bumps
oslo.messaging to align with global requirements.

Change-Id: If22df56a3b3af1e62b9f29fa1be1276d7cf7776d
Closes-Bug: #1519182
"}]
commit_message:
remove unnecessary mock for rpc server start

latest oslo.messaging 3.0.0 requires invoking start() first then stop()
can be called, but we've mocked the start() which will hang the process
then finally raise TimeoutException.

This patch removes unnecessary mock for rpc server start(), and bumps
oslo.messaging to align with global requirements.

Change-Id: If22df56a3b3af1e62b9f29fa1be1276d7cf7776d
Closes-Bug: #1519182

commit_message:
Remove _keystone_identity method

_keystone_identity method has been maintained for backward
compatibility. But there is no place to use it now so this patch
replace _keystone_identity method to _integrated_keystone_identity
method as _keystone_identity.

Change-Id: I9464c047401f92ae31a5d3bb7aacaeb0624150e0

commit_message:
Public environment template

This feature will allow having private and public environment templates, as well as,
to obtain all public templates from all tenants. In addition, a clone functionality
is added to copy a template from a tenant to another.

Change-Id: I702d9d707cb14195278b1cc2084fe9609660a3fe
Targets-blueprint: abstract-env-template

code when some referenced object cannot be found when performing
operations on some entities.

commit_message:
Change admin IP ranges in tests for node groups

Change default IP addresses range for admin/pxe network
in system test for multiple cluster networks feature.
Check that DHCP range is configured properly and Nailgun
doesn't allocate excluded from range IPs to nodes.

Change-Id: I64069e287a6970b93931d93212efb0c1712af40a
Closes-bug: #1513154

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2015-11-23 16:02:57.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/tests/test_cfg.py', 'oslo_config/cfg.py'], 'message': "Add 'mutable' param to Opt

re: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/mitaka-cross-project-dynamic-config-services

oslo.config already offers a reload_config_files method. This patch adds
a 'mutable' flag to Opt, allowing services to mark which opts may be
reloaded. It also adds a flag to ConfigOpts, 'limit_mutation', to say
that when reload_config_files is called, only mutable opts should be
changed. If a new value for an immutable opt is detected, a warning is
issued.

Change-Id: I719874b58e64bc4f8535c85da43670779fbfd380
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'mutable' param to Opt

re: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/mitaka-cross-project-dynamic-config-services

oslo.config already offers a reload_config_files method. This patch adds
a 'mutable' flag to Opt, allowing services to mark which opts may be
reloaded. It also adds a flag to ConfigOpts, 'limit_mutation', to say
that when reload_config_files is called, only mutable opts should be
changed. If a new value for an immutable opt is detected, a warning is
issued.

Change-Id: I719874b58e64bc4f8535c85da43670779fbfd380

commit_message:
Let cluster-create return 400 if profile not found

This is part of a series of patches to come that fix the return status
code of the HTTP API request. When referenced objects (not the entity
itself) is not found, we should return 400 (bad request) instead of 404
(not found).

Change-Id: I14a2dfed744ca41a1f288d14fe052c698f223827
Partial-Bug: #1518209

commit_message:
Fix with-items concurrency greater than the number of items

If the list provided to with-items has length less than the value provided
in concurrency, the engine throws an exception index out of range.

Change-Id: Ib9425f00a735c2fa09b685486aff02511094d991

commit_message:
Remove preprov provider dependencies from CONF

This commit removes the last dependencie of the preprov
provider from CONF. The required configuration is passed
now as parameters at init time.

As the number of parameter grows, and many of them are taken from
configuration, adding dicts with parameters that can be used
when instantiating the credentials providers.

Depends-on: I0ca0b96fc618ffe60851984a9c6d46b0507878d4
Partially-implements: bp tempest-library
Change-Id: I945994580ce9a29f6fbf67183e5da4b100542386

Refactors firewall rules to create source

commit_message:
Refactor firewall to listen on only on internal networks

Refactors firewall rules to create source
based rules that only permit connections
from the management network for most services.

The only services that should have public access
are Horizon and OpenStack APIs. And from those,
nova metadata and nova VNC should only be
accessible internally. All other services should
accept connections from private or storage
networks.

New defined type openstack::firewall::multi_net
accepts firewall definitions with an array of
source networks.

New function prepare_firewall_rules creates a hash
of firewall rules coming from an array of source
networks.

Removed unneeded openstack::firewall::allow class.
Obsoleted openstack::firewall:vnc defined type.

Sorted parameters on openstack::firewall and added
docstrings

DocImpact: TBD

Change-Id: Ie63c01dcbd0bbd9adf17363b0db0b0a99b837b4e
Closes-Bug: #1514014

commit_message:
Networks tab does not show external configuration

When you create a network you can specify it as
external network. When the network is listed
in Horizon 'Networks' tab we do not see any
column indicating if network is 'external' .
It is nice to enhance the network tab to add a
new column showing 'external' indicating whether
network is 'external'.

Change-Id: I5cbd612b47f842fcb669b72ee4bf076ccd554356
Close-Bug:#1350237

revisions:
[{'number': 25, 'created': '2015-11-23 17:51:55.000000000', 'files': ['devops/helpers/templates.py', 'devops/templates/read.me', 'devops/shell.py', 'devops/settings.py', 'devops/templates/default.yaml', 'devops/models/node.py', 'devops/models/environment.py'], 'message': "Move to template-based configuration of devops environments

To create a devops virtual environment (networks, volumes, nodes),
now can be used YAML template desctibed in [1].

How it can be used:

* New approach, environment will be created using the data from
  full_config object:

  environment.create_environment(full_config)

* Old-style approach (deprecated), in this case at first will be
  created a 'full_config' object using shell environment variables,
  and then called environment.create_environment(full_config):

  environment.describe_environment(boot_from='cdrom'):

* Override old-style approach, in this case the YAML config will
  be read from the file located in DEVOPS_SETTINGS_TEMPLATE shell
  environment variable to the 'full_config' object and passed to
  create_environment(full_config); creating config in old-style
  will be skipped:

  export DEVOPS_SETTINGS_TEMPLATE=/tmp/some_template_file.yaml

- add create_envoronment() method that creates environment from
  provided config.
- environment.describe() method is temporary disabled until new
  database schema be implemented, where all necessary details could
  be passed from define() to desctibe() via database objects.
- add template generator for keep legacy behaviour of the
  method describe_environment()
- Environment.define() is deprecated and left for back compatibility
  with older fuel-qa branches
- Some objects in template require the extended database schema,
  so in this patch there are some workarounds to use templates with
  original schema (particular data from address_pools and
  l2_network_devices are stored in the Network model)

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/240170/

Change-Id: Iad081bee94c4d3b404eda57b7c1c31011b837ba7
Implements: blueprint template-based-virtual-devops-environments
"}]
commit_message:
Move to template-based configuration of devops environments

To create a devops virtual environment (networks, volumes, nodes),
now can be used YAML template desctibed in [1].

How it can be used:

* New approach, environment will be created using the data from
  full_config object:

  environment.create_environment(full_config)

* Old-style approach (deprecated), in this case at first will be
  created a 'full_config' object using shell environment variables,
  and then called environment.create_environment(full_config):

  environment.describe_environment(boot_from='cdrom'):

* Override old-style approach, in this case the YAML config will
  be read from the file located in DEVOPS_SETTINGS_TEMPLATE shell
  environment variable to the 'full_config' object and passed to
  create_environment(full_config); creating config in old-style
  will be skipped:

  export DEVOPS_SETTINGS_TEMPLATE=/tmp/some_template_file.yaml

- add create_envoronment() method that creates environment from
  provided config.
- environment.describe() method is temporary disabled until new
  database schema be implemented, where all necessary details could
  be passed from define() to desctibe() via database objects.
- add template generator for keep legacy behaviour of the
  method describe_environment()
- Environment.define() is deprecated and left for back compatibility
  with older fuel-qa branches
- Some objects in template require the extended database schema,
  so in this patch there are some workarounds to use templates with
  original schema (particular data from address_pools and
  l2_network_devices are stored in the Network model)

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/240170/

Change-Id: Iad081bee94c4d3b404eda57b7c1c31011b837ba7
Implements: blueprint template-based-virtual-devops-environments

commit_message:
Fix bootstrap for services

The bootstrap tasks could be started on any node listed in the
site.yml

The issue is that all the tasks must run on the same node, and the
only node that all the tasks can run on is the 'api' node due to
needing to start the bootstrap container which binds in the configs.

delegate_to is required to ensure that the proper node gets the task.

Co-Authored-By: Sam Yaple <sam@yaple.net>
Change-Id: Ica04ab366777a571a92212ac22c482f1881d4ecd
Closes-Bug: #1513598
Related-Bug: #1513439
(cherry picked from commit 790bf336d5e082c5c079bfb681f9509188eae72f)

commit_message:
Rewrite table filtering to use GET-requests

Before this patch server table filtering was built on
POST requests, wich is conceptually wrong and makes
impossible to filter data on redirect to the table.

This patch rewrites server table filtering to use
GET request by changing methods get_filter_string() and
get_filter_field().
Also this patch adds some js-code to handle actions in
the filter form.
Now url can contain filtering information, which makes
possible to redirect user to filtered table.

Change-Id: I4910295e5fe17ba15f0d8b873131da795747ee80
Closes-Bug: #1368338
Co-Authored-By: Timur Sufiev <tsufiev@mirantis.com>

subject: fix some test case wrongly skipped for mysql backend
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-24 09:02:28.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/db.py'], 'message': 'fix some test case wrongly skipped for mysql backend

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/235831/ enables all test cases for
ysql when PyMySQL is used as MySQL driver, but some test cases are
specified via run_with() decorator, which might expect engine is mysql
while actually we provide mysql+pymysql, so these test cases will be
wrongly skipped.

This patch maps mysql+pymysql to mysql to make sure there is an engine
handles it for such case.

Change-Id: I062d1d04b4b1511626a9b02f0249b5c93b5592b8
Closes-Bug: #1519211
'}]
commit_message:
fix some test case wrongly skipped for mysql backend

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/235831/ enables all test cases for
ysql when PyMySQL is used as MySQL driver, but some test cases are
specified via run_with() decorator, which might expect engine is mysql
while actually we provide mysql+pymysql, so these test cases will be
wrongly skipped.

This patch maps mysql+pymysql to mysql to make sure there is an engine
handles it for such case.

Change-Id: I062d1d04b4b1511626a9b02f0249b5c93b5592b8
Closes-Bug: #1519211

we'd better explicitly specify 'enforce_type=True', or else there is a

oslo.config project may fix this param to be default to True, each
project using this call is encouraged to set it.

[1]
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-November/079633.html

Change-Id: I09f9e667cc01b6cb4b7fb5003527608a44f9a6bc

commit_message:
Fix CONF.set_override usage

As mentioned in the following mail thread [1], when using CONF.set_override,
we'd better explicitly specify 'enforce_type=True', or else there is a
risk that what we are testing is not what users will be using. While the
oslo.config project may fix this param to be default to True, each
project using this call is encouraged to set it.

[1]
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-November/079633.html

Change-Id: I09f9e667cc01b6cb4b7fb5003527608a44f9a6bc

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-18 10:25:33.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/contrib/s3/core.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_contrib_s3_core.py'], 'message': "Fix string conversion in s3 handler for python 2

creds_ref['secret'] in s3/ec2 controller has type unicode.
and result type of six.b('AWS4' + secret) is an unicode.
but hmac.new decoder can't work with unicode strings - it
needs 'str' type in python 2.
So here simple change is needed - encode result string as 'utf-8'.
Same conversion we have in signature v1 checking.

Also two comments from previous review was fixed.

Change-Id: I80d862956eace35753f00459d49150a62f07101a
Related-Bug: #1473042
"}]
commit_message:
Fix string conversion in s3 handler for python 2

creds_ref['secret'] in s3/ec2 controller has type unicode.
and result type of six.b('AWS4' + secret) is an unicode.
but hmac.new decoder can't work with unicode strings - it
needs 'str' type in python 2.
So here simple change is needed - encode result string as 'utf-8'.
Same conversion we have in signature v1 checking.

Also two comments from previous review was fixed.

Change-Id: I80d862956eace35753f00459d49150a62f07101a
Related-Bug: #1473042

commit_message:
Add parameter sanitization for policy-attach

This patch adds logic to sanitize the parameters provided to a
policy-attach call. The parameter types and values are validated. If
any of the validations fail, a webob.HTTPBadRequest is thrown.

Change-Id: I4a081de911cf0fd2cf8ded1ab1b8c0e0f7b83c7a
Closes-Bug: #1465509
