reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9107, 'name': 'Victor Stinner', 'email': 'vstinner@redhat.com', 'username': 'haypo'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10618, 'name': 'Pavel Kholkin', 'email': 'p.v.holkin@mail.ru', 'username': 'pkholkin'}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-18 11:18:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_cloudpipe.py', 'nova/servicegroup/drivers/db.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/imagecache.py', 'nova/scheduler/filters/trusted_filter.py', 'nova/api/ec2/ec2utils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/cells/test_cells_messaging.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/simple_tenant_usage.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/ec2/test_apirequest.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/simple_tenant_usage.py', 'nova/context.py'], 'message': 'Replace parse_strtime() with parse_isotime()

* Replace parse_strtime(ts) with parse_isotime(ts)
* Replace parse_strtime(ts, fmt) with
  datetime.datetime.strptime(ts, fmt)
* simple_tenant_usage.py: replace the loop trying 3 different timestamp
  format with parse_strtime() with parse_isotime(), parse_isotime()
  already supports the 3 tested formats (and more)
* test_apirequest.py: use directly the datetime.datetime() constructor
  instead of parsing a string
* test_cells_messaging.py: mock parse_isotime() using mock.patch instead
  of mocking it using mox (mock API is simpler than mox API)
* db/sqlalchemy/api.py: since parse_strtime() is replaced with
  parse_isotime(), there is no need to fallback on parse_isotime() on
  error

oslo_utils.timeutils.parse_isotime() is a superset of parse_strtime().
parse_isotime() accepts timestamps without microseconds and timestamps
with timezone, whereas parse_strtime() requires a timestamp formatted by
strtime() (with microseconds and without any timezone information).

parse_isotime() always create "aware" datetime objects: with a timezone
information. If the timestamp has no timezone information, the UTC
timezone is used by default.

This change is required to prepare nova to replace
oslo_utils.timeutils.strtime(), function deprecated in oslo.utils 1.6.
It is suggested to replace strtime(ts) with ts.isoformat().
parse_strtime() raises an error on timestamp without microsecond,
whereas the .isoformat() method omits microseconds in the output (the
".000000" suffix) if the microsecond attribute is equal to zero:

    >>> timeutils.strtime(datetime.datetime(2015, 7, 1, 10, 24, 22))
    '2015-07-01T10:24:22.000000'
    >>> datetime.datetime(2015, 7, 1, 10, 24, 22).isoformat()
    '2015-07-01T10:24:22'

blueprint liberty-olso-sync

Change-Id: I591b55be2a7552c5da6f2a0bcd758023210f67d6'}]
commit_message:
Replace parse_strtime() with parse_isotime()

* Replace parse_strtime(ts) with parse_isotime(ts)
* Replace parse_strtime(ts, fmt) with
  datetime.datetime.strptime(ts, fmt)
* simple_tenant_usage.py: replace the loop trying 3 different timestamp
  format with parse_strtime() with parse_isotime(), parse_isotime()
  already supports the 3 tested formats (and more)
* test_apirequest.py: use directly the datetime.datetime() constructor
  instead of parsing a string
* test_cells_messaging.py: mock parse_isotime() using mock.patch instead
  of mocking it using mox (mock API is simpler than mox API)
* db/sqlalchemy/api.py: since parse_strtime() is replaced with
  parse_isotime(), there is no need to fallback on parse_isotime() on
  error

oslo_utils.timeutils.parse_isotime() is a superset of parse_strtime().
parse_isotime() accepts timestamps without microseconds and timestamps
with timezone, whereas parse_strtime() requires a timestamp formatted by
strtime() (with microseconds and without any timezone information).

parse_isotime() always create "aware" datetime objects: with a timezone
information. If the timestamp has no timezone information, the UTC
timezone is used by default.

This change is required to prepare nova to replace
oslo_utils.timeutils.strtime(), function deprecated in oslo.utils 1.6.
It is suggested to replace strtime(ts) with ts.isoformat().
parse_strtime() raises an error on timestamp without microsecond,
whereas the .isoformat() method omits microseconds in the output (the
".000000" suffix) if the microsecond attribute is equal to zero:

    >>> timeutils.strtime(datetime.datetime(2015, 7, 1, 10, 24, 22))
    '2015-07-01T10:24:22.000000'
    >>> datetime.datetime(2015, 7, 1, 10, 24, 22).isoformat()
    '2015-07-01T10:24:22'

blueprint liberty-olso-sync

Change-Id: I591b55be2a7552c5da6f2a0bcd758023210f67d6

commit_message:
Mellanox ethernet driver (mlx4_en) autoloading together with core driver

Mellanox ethernet driver (mlx4_en) should be loaded together together with
core driver (mlx4_core).

This fix for default CentOS provision image taken from the libmlx4 package.

Change-Id: Ic1c26ff610fc657d05a854e81cf3681f3eeb0c45
Closes-Bug: #1501309

subject: Quota Policy Engine
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-15 17:39:56.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/approved/quota-policy-engine.rst'], 'message': 'Quota Policy Engine

There are many different ways that deployers may want to slice
their private cloud - availability zones, aggregates exposed
via flavors and special flavors being the most common amongst
all the available options. There are different ways to impose
quota based on the slice mechanism used. Quota policy engine
provide a way to validate whether a particular quota operation
is valid or not depending on the actual resource consumption
and what is requested by the incoming request.

Change-Id: I88c73d051e324bebe46d6f9df6067fa9330e70a8
Implements: blueprint quota-policy-engine
'}]
commit_message:
Quota Policy Engine

There are many different ways that deployers may want to slice
their private cloud - availability zones, aggregates exposed
via flavors and special flavors being the most common amongst
all the available options. There are different ways to impose
quota based on the slice mechanism used. Quota policy engine
provide a way to validate whether a particular quota operation
is valid or not depending on the actual resource consumption
and what is requested by the incoming request.

Change-Id: I88c73d051e324bebe46d6f9df6067fa9330e70a8
Implements: blueprint quota-policy-engine

subject: Quota by Flavor, Quota by AZ or Quota by (Flavor and AZ)

revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2015-08-11 08:19:13.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/approved/dynamic-quota-resource.rst'], 'message': 'Quota by Flavor, Quota by AZ or Quota by (Flavor and AZ)

There are multiple ways to slice an Openstack cloud - availability
zones, aggregates exposed via flavors and special flavors being the
most common amongst all the available options. These options are used
for better operability, managebility and providing specific
features to enhance performance. But even though we have a way to
segregate the cloud as per these options, at present, there is
no option provided for an Openstack admin to set and manage Quota
by Flavor, Quota by AZ or both.

This spec plans to solve this problem by introducing the concept
of dynamic resources. A dynamic resource can be a combination of
availability zone, flavor or hardware type aggregate exposed via
a flavor which can help for effective quota management in these
common deployment scenarios.

Co-Authored-By: Vilobh Meshram <vilobhmm@yahoo-inc.com>
Co-Authored-By: Joshua Harlow <harlowja@yahoo-inc.com>
blueprint dynamic-quota-resource
Change-Id: I13b8e15896ffcb7d3aafe6bffb394ef1c8f487ca
'}]
commit_message:
Quota by Flavor, Quota by AZ or Quota by (Flavor and AZ)

There are multiple ways to slice an Openstack cloud - availability
zones, aggregates exposed via flavors and special flavors being the
most common amongst all the available options. These options are used
for better operability, managebility and providing specific
features to enhance performance. But even though we have a way to
segregate the cloud as per these options, at present, there is
no option provided for an Openstack admin to set and manage Quota
by Flavor, Quota by AZ or both.

This spec plans to solve this problem by introducing the concept
of dynamic resources. A dynamic resource can be a combination of
availability zone, flavor or hardware type aggregate exposed via
a flavor which can help for effective quota management in these
common deployment scenarios.

Co-Authored-By: Vilobh Meshram <vilobhmm@yahoo-inc.com>
Co-Authored-By: Joshua Harlow <harlowja@yahoo-inc.com>
blueprint dynamic-quota-resource
Change-Id: I13b8e15896ffcb7d3aafe6bffb394ef1c8f487ca

subject: Limit the number of instances that a user can spawn in a time window
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-08 15:48:04.000000000', 'files': ['specs/backlog/approved/limit-spawn-rate-for-users.rst'], 'message': 'Limit the number of instances that a user can spawn in a time window

Rate-limits can limit API calls, but on POST */servers, there is
a possibility to specify max_count and ask large number of instances
in a very short time.
As operator, I want to rate-limit the real instance creation, not
only the API calls.

Change-Id: I49ade2885bab4671474567e72c892de6c2677778
'}]
commit_message:
Limit the number of instances that a user can spawn in a time window

Rate-limits can limit API calls, but on POST */servers, there is
a possibility to specify max_count and ask large number of instances
in a very short time.
As operator, I want to rate-limit the real instance creation, not
only the API calls.

Change-Id: I49ade2885bab4671474567e72c892de6c2677778

commit_message:
deprecate `enabled` option for endpoint-policy extension

the endpoint-policy extension, like the other recently moved
extensions, should be always enabled. Since this option made
its way into the liberty release we need to mark the option
as deprecated in M and remove it in O

implements bp: move-extensions

Change-Id: I5c01da0663c636bc6e2d9f12ac02b53edb9a277f

commit_message:
Implement Ovs2Ovs patch support CentOS7/RHEL7

*Implement ovs port for Ubuntu and Centos7/RHEL7
*Test coverage

Closes-bug: #1514421

subject: Live migrate local disk
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-28 05:19:34.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/approved/live-migrate-local-disk.rst'], 'message': 'Live migrate local disk

User is not allowed to execute live-migration of
a booted from volume instance which have a local disk
in non-shared storage environment.
This blueprint make it enable by copying local disk
from the source host to the destination host.

Blueprint: live-migrate-local-disk
Change-Id: I1a44685cbbed7364b8bb8566075f67f481d3a1c4
'}]
commit_message:
Live migrate local disk

User is not allowed to execute live-migration of
a booted from volume instance which have a local disk
in non-shared storage environment.
This blueprint make it enable by copying local disk
from the source host to the destination host.

Blueprint: live-migrate-local-disk
Change-Id: I1a44685cbbed7364b8bb8566075f67f481d3a1c4

subject: Really skip directories for translation sync
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-23 08:32:41.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/common_translation_update.sh'], 'message': 'Really skip directories for translation sync

This fixes a problem on stable/liberty for openstack-manuals where only
2 out of 12 directories should be translated. But we currently push all
12 source files to the server.

If we have directories that contain locale files, we need to explicitly
exclude them. Add the skip directories to the exclude list for
manual projects.

Change-Id: I1eb481772545261c293baa0eb35731a8ac92d53c
'}]
commit_message:
Really skip directories for translation sync

This fixes a problem on stable/liberty for openstack-manuals where only
2 out of 12 directories should be translated. But we currently push all
12 source files to the server.

If we have directories that contain locale files, we need to explicitly
exclude them. Add the skip directories to the exclude list for
manual projects.

Change-Id: I1eb481772545261c293baa0eb35731a8ac92d53c

commit_message:
tripleo.sh initial support for stable branches

Adds STABLE_RELEASE variable, which can be set, e.g to "liberty"
such that we configure the repos to use the centos7-liberty current
repos instead of trunk.

This automates the steps documented in:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238600/

Change-Id: I34ea635382114bf4f075f3d8df1188c3beae8727
(cherry picked from commit 17209ca9d6a980201dbee90f1699f07baf118aca)

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-24 08:56:42.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/tests/unit/apiv1/test_profiles.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/test_rpc_client.py', 'senlin/api/openstack/v1/profiles.py', 'senlin/rpc/client.py'], 'message': "Disallow profile update for spec

Previously we support creating new profiles when doing profile-update,
if a new 'spec' is provided. However, this looks like an abuse of the
'update' operation. It creates more confusion than convenience. This
patch proposes removing 'spec' from the update interface. More patches
will come to remove this completely. This is only about the API and the
RPC client layer.

Change-Id: Id8edf1d1bcb33f85dbdad614dd4db27285f17d0a
"}]
commit_message:
Disallow profile update for spec

Previously we support creating new profiles when doing profile-update,
if a new 'spec' is provided. However, this looks like an abuse of the
'update' operation. It creates more confusion than convenience. This
patch proposes removing 'spec' from the update interface. More patches
will come to remove this completely. This is only about the API and the
RPC client layer.

Change-Id: Id8edf1d1bcb33f85dbdad614dd4db27285f17d0a

subject: scan all changes and filter on files in reno not git log
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-23 19:17:07.000000000', 'files': ['reno/scanner.py', 'reno/tests/test_scanner.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-scanner-tag-detection-ef0a95c12a90f167.yaml'], 'message': 'scan all changes and filter on files in reno not git log

Scanning only changes with reno files in them means we miss some of the
git tags in the repository history, so include all patches in the git
log output and then filter them in reno based on patches that include
any release notes files.

Closes-bug: #1517175
Change-Id: I36c0a54e20d47fff9af2b7f82c5380d97345a625
'}]
commit_message:
scan all changes and filter on files in reno not git log

Scanning only changes with reno files in them means we miss some of the
git tags in the repository history, so include all patches in the git
log output and then filter them in reno based on patches that include
any release notes files.

Closes-bug: #1517175
Change-Id: I36c0a54e20d47fff9af2b7f82c5380d97345a625

subject: Fix bug introduced by openstacksdk
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-24 07:01:36.000000000', 'files': ['senlinclient/common/sdk.py', 'senlinclient/shell.py', 'senlinclient/v1/client.py'], 'message': "Fix bug introduced by openstacksdk

This patch sets the default auth_plugin to 'password', it also removes
the authenticator reference from client module. These code are breaking
the client code.

Change-Id: I7f815d3847b0bd0f5e6c3f78c2cc0efd3c80a523
"}]
commit_message:
Fix bug introduced by openstacksdk

This patch sets the default auth_plugin to 'password', it also removes
the authenticator reference from client module. These code are breaking
the client code.

Change-Id: I7f815d3847b0bd0f5e6c3f78c2cc0efd3c80a523

commit_message:
remove elasticsearch method delete_by_query

The elasticsearch method delete_by_query has been removed
from the api because deprecated since elasticsearch 1.7

see:
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/1.7/docs-delete-by-query.html

Change-Id: Ib21708c7147f4202eb7e4dba7a64adbc192d94af

commit_message:
Mellanox ethernet driver (mlx4_en) autoloading together with core driver

Mellanox ethernet driver (mlx4_en) should be loaded together together with
core driver (mlx4_core).

This fix for default CentOS provision image taken from the libmlx4 package.

Change-Id: Ic1c26ff610fc657d05a854e81cf3681f3eeb0c45
Closes-Bug: #1501309

subject: Fixed broken assignment to dictionary using integer key
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-14 18:59:55.000000000', 'files': ['murano/dsl/lhs_expression.py'], 'message': 'Fixed broken assignment to dictionary using integer key

The case

$dict[$key]: value

for integer $key was not addressed in LHS expression logic.
As a result no changes were made to $dict and no error was raised.

Change-Id: I969dab5f0d32312cf52490945934557c32f22dde
Closes-Bug: #1515612
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed broken assignment to dictionary using integer key

The case

$dict[$key]: value

for integer $key was not addressed in LHS expression logic.
As a result no changes were made to $dict and no error was raised.

Change-Id: I969dab5f0d32312cf52490945934557c32f22dde
Closes-Bug: #1515612

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-11-23 14:52:15.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/l23network/lib/puppet/provider/l23_stored_config/ovs_ubuntu.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/spec/functions/configure_default_route__spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/l23network/lib/puppet/type/l23_stored_config.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/netconfig/configure_default_route.pp', 'deployment/puppet/l23network/lib/puppet/provider/l23_stored_config/ovs_centos6.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/lib/puppet/parser/functions/configure_default_route.rb', 'deployment/puppet/l23network/lib/puppet/provider/l23_stored_config/ovs_centos7.rb', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/netconfig/configure_default_route_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Refactor function configure_default_route

Before the function configure_default_route was a little part of function
generate_network_config which changed default gateway only, due to the provider
for interfaces was not picked correctly.
Now if default route is needed to change we just modify network_scheme
and call generate_network_config with this network_scheme, if no - do
nothing.
Leave only provider lnx as default for l23_stored_config.

Change-Id: I33e88550af5d5cce2886254444ee5d450e578a1c
Closes-bug: #1510072
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor function configure_default_route

Before the function configure_default_route was a little part of function
generate_network_config which changed default gateway only, due to the provider
for interfaces was not picked correctly.
Now if default route is needed to change we just modify network_scheme
and call generate_network_config with this network_scheme, if no - do
nothing.
Leave only provider lnx as default for l23_stored_config.

Change-Id: I33e88550af5d5cce2886254444ee5d450e578a1c
Closes-bug: #1510072

commit_message:
Allow filtering using unicode characters

Current code forces the filter arguments to be converted
to a byte string using str() which prevents filtering
using unicode characters. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: I3abef5da4c2614806011440a4443e869920b4afd
Partial-Bug: 1472999

the default one are used.

subject: Fix default domain.
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-11-20 10:50:42.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/provider/keystone_user/openstack_spec.rb', 'spec/unit/type/keystone_user_spec.rb', 'spec/unit/type/keystone_user_role_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_domain/openstack.rb', 'spec/unit/type/keystone_tenant_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_user_role/openstack.rb', 'spec/unit/provider/keystone_service/openstack_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/keystone_user_role.rb', 'manifests/init.pp', 'lib/puppet_x/keystone/type/default_domain.rb', 'spec/unit/provider/keystone_domain/openstack_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_tenant/openstack.rb', 'README.md', 'spec/shared_examples.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_user/openstack.rb', 'spec/spec_helper.rb', 'spec/unit/provider/keystone_tenant/openstack_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/keystone_tenant.rb', 'spec/acceptance/default_domain_spec.rb', 'spec/unit/provider/keystone_user_role/openstack_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/keystone_user.rb'], 'message': "Fix default domain.

After the move to composite namevar a problem could occur if another
module was using indirection to find resource by name.

If the manifest didn't have any
keystone_user/keystone_tenant/keystone_user_role definition, then, the
'Default' domain would be appended to the name.

This patch, fix that by simplifying the rule for calculating the default
domain.

It now strictly follows what is described there https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219127/

Change-Id: Ic2efb51fe76d055307c8c27fa79015764417160b
Closes-Bug: #1517187
"}]
commit_message:
Fix default domain.

After the move to composite namevar a problem could occur if another
module was using indirection to find resource by name.

If the manifest didn't have any
keystone_user/keystone_tenant/keystone_user_role definition, then, the
'Default' domain would be appended to the name.

This patch, fix that by simplifying the rule for calculating the default
domain.

It now strictly follows what is described there https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219127/

Change-Id: Ic2efb51fe76d055307c8c27fa79015764417160b
Closes-Bug: #1517187

commit_message:
Add parameters to nova

    Added options:

	api_paste_config
	fping_path
	allow_resize_to_same_host
	use_local
	live_migration_flag
	block_migration_flag
	multi_host
	auto_assign_floating_ip

Change-Id: I4665344bb0049fe2b7080c2f4dbca01e011f4f1d

commit_message:
Bump RAM to 1G for ironic-inspector IPA job

likely cause of current gate failures. Lower VM count to 1 to reduce
load on infra.

commit_message:
Log error instead of exception trace

In impl_vsctl we rather use LOG.error instead of
LOG.exception. In these case the exception trace did not provide
any valuable information.

Change-Id: Ia02f000d460b3aee72a31e9963e5d0e0d4c68315
Closes-bug: #1518429

commit_message:
Floating IP range support in Nova network

This patch provides a possibility to add
ip ranges of networks (i.e.: 192.168.1.210-192.168.1.224)
to a floating ip pool.

Depends-On: I802280e4e2912c9aed1c10d519ead84b1f22f900

Change-Id: Iffb0af32753708decb8d2b60f1075b66f7520553

subject: remove python26-jobs from remaining oslo libraries
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-23 19:24:12.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "remove python26-jobs from remaining oslo libraries

The Oslo team is dropping python 2.6 support for all libraries. Many
already have the jobs removed, but a few didn't. This patch cleans up
the remaining libraries, except pbr which has to continue to be tested
with 2.6 until all of its consuming projects have dropped 2.6 support.

Change-Id: I516356b4d2e39c092acc667c8f493f02a3050a19
"}]
commit_message:
remove python26-jobs from remaining oslo libraries

The Oslo team is dropping python 2.6 support for all libraries. Many
already have the jobs removed, but a few didn't. This patch cleans up
the remaining libraries, except pbr which has to continue to be tested
with 2.6 until all of its consuming projects have dropped 2.6 support.

Change-Id: I516356b4d2e39c092acc667c8f493f02a3050a19

Availability zone aware dhcp scheduler uses hosted agents list
to schedule dhcp agent to proper availability zone.
The scheduler can avoid scheduling the same availalibity zone as
agents host a network which should be distributed for HA.

Change-Id: Ib01f6d852956dc1e89b83321d657c0baf829e28a
Partially-implements: blueprint add-availability-zone
'}]
commit_message:
Add hosted agents list to dhcp agent scheduler

Availability zone aware dhcp scheduler uses hosted agents list
to schedule dhcp agent to proper availability zone.
The scheduler can avoid scheduling the same availalibity zone as
agents host a network which should be distributed for HA.

Change-Id: Ib01f6d852956dc1e89b83321d657c0baf829e28a
Partially-implements: blueprint add-availability-zone

subject: Fix resource tracker VCPU counting
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 1063, 'name': 'Ed Leafe', 'email': 'ed@leafe.com', 'username': 'ed-leafe'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 7166, 'name': 'Sylvain Bauza', 'email': 'sbauza@redhat.com', 'username': 'sbauza'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16897, 'name': 'Virtuozzo Storage CI', 'email': 'vzstorage-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'vzstorage-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16898, 'name': 'Virtuozzo CI', 'email': 'virtuozzo6-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'virtuozzo6-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-23 14:57:02.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_tracker.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'message': "Fix resource tracker VCPU counting

The resource track is double counting the number of
vcpus used because it counts the virt driver's view
and the resource tracker's view. It should reset
the count to 0 before counting the resourcet racker's
view. this is done for other resources (memory, disk)
in _update_usage_from_instances().

This was not caught in unit tests because they always
provide a virt driver view with no resource used for
tests that assume instances are already running.

This patch adds the reset to 0 and modifies the
tests to provide correct counts of used resources
from the virt driver.

Change-Id: I21acfd7d5b5ed442cd1e9049c986a06bd2b59b81
Closes-Bug: #1519001
"}]
commit_message:
Fix resource tracker VCPU counting

The resource track is double counting the number of
vcpus used because it counts the virt driver's view
and the resource tracker's view. It should reset
the count to 0 before counting the resourcet racker's
view. this is done for other resources (memory, disk)
in _update_usage_from_instances().

This was not caught in unit tests because they always
provide a virt driver view with no resource used for
tests that assume instances are already running.

This patch adds the reset to 0 and modifies the
tests to provide correct counts of used resources
from the virt driver.

Change-Id: I21acfd7d5b5ed442cd1e9049c986a06bd2b59b81
Closes-Bug: #1519001

Transport module is removed from pythonopenstacksdk. This patch

subject: Fix cluster-list api inconsistency
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-23 03:25:28.000000000', 'files': ['doc/api-site/api-ref/src/wadls/clustering-api/src/v1/clustering-api.wadl', 'senlin/tests/unit/apiv1/test_clusters.py', 'senlin/api/openstack/v1/clusters.py', 'senlin/api/openstack/v1/nodes.py'], 'message': "Fix cluster-list api inconsistency

This patch fixes the API parameters for cluster-list call. The
parameters 'project', 'parent', 'user' are removed to be consistent with
node-list API call. We can add these parameters later when requested.
This patch adds real support to 'global_project' for cluster-list, which
was defaulted to 'True' before.

Change-Id: Icab38c970de7704c3134afd1b96a03b3670bd2ad
Closes-Bug: #1465924
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cluster-list api inconsistency

This patch fixes the API parameters for cluster-list call. The
parameters 'project', 'parent', 'user' are removed to be consistent with
node-list API call. We can add these parameters later when requested.
This patch adds real support to 'global_project' for cluster-list, which
was defaulted to 'True' before.

Change-Id: Icab38c970de7704c3134afd1b96a03b3670bd2ad
Closes-Bug: #1465924

commit_message:
Enable "openstack server resume" command to take multiple servers.

Current "openstack server resume" command could only resume one server.
Improve it to be able to handle more than one servers. Also improve
the doc to reflect the new feature.

Change-Id: I726eb86bfa3df3a9911f45770e6641264dbc1e0b
Implements: blueprint cmd-with-multi-servers

commit_message:

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-16 13:38:29.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_convg_stack.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py'], 'message': "Convergence: Avoid sync point delete for stack CREATE

Previous traversal sync points should be deleted in case of concurrent
updates. However, in case of stack CREATE there won't be any previous
traversal sync points to delete.
Hence avoid hitting the DB.

Change-Id: If61332107a1f4d70a590f7db87b6c10bc9cf7b2c
"}]
commit_message:
Convergence: Avoid sync point delete for stack CREATE

Previous traversal sync points should be deleted in case of concurrent
updates. However, in case of stack CREATE there won't be any previous
traversal sync points to delete.
Hence avoid hitting the DB.

Change-Id: If61332107a1f4d70a590f7db87b6c10bc9cf7b2c

commit_message:
Using the right format to render the docstring correctly

There are several issues in the docstring, the format is not
correct, not using the full path of class etc.

This patch corrects all of them, so the docstring will be rendered
correctly.

Change-Id: I04d5818f38b5e75b6f6197ef5e13dcd64ed91bf4

roles_for_user when using keystone v3.

commit_message:
Remove useless LOG definitions

This change removes LOG definition:

  LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__)

in modules not needed it.

Change-Id: I16daae56d8fa5e86a7bb627e7588d0cb60dc552a

commit_message:

Senlinclient depends on openstacksdk and new version of
openstacksdk affects senlinclient, so skip senlin_plugin tests
for now until senlinclient fix this problem.

Partial-Bug: #1519185

commit_message:
Make sure we return unicode strings for process output

Process output is supposed to be represented with lines, so we should
put Python strings in the queue (not bytes). Just in case, we do it only
for Python 3 environment.

To fix that, we reuse code from utils.execute() linux/windows
implementations.

This fixes the TestAsyncProcess.test_async_process_respawns functional
test for Python 3 environment.

Related-Bug: #1515118
Change-Id: I9efec2290003add44909aab33a0026372a580016

commit_message:
Use Tempest-lib's compute images_client

Compute images_client has been migrated to
tempest-lib- I495915a5a40f7d351cb69463c032281e02c907c7

Now Tempest-lib provides this client as stable interface so Tempest
should start using this from lib and remove its own copy.
Also remove its unit tests.

This commits makes Tempest to use compute images_client
from Tempest-lib.

Change-Id: I4a32fed401251a26081a052f009d9cbee86ed11f

commit_message:
IRR - Implemented for setup-hosts

The change removes and points our role requirements to use
the independent repos that are now online. Updates to the
Ansible bootstrap script here remove the forced "updated"
that was happening on every bootstrap so that we're ensuring
a stable build based on a described version.

Change-Id: If7f83d0875a5b074f506235d650be48a6e461e56
Implements: blueprint independent-role-repositories
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Update confusing note
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-23 20:37:13.000000000', 'files': ['doc/admin-guide-cloud/source/identity_concepts.rst'], 'message': "Update confusing note

The note saying that services other than Identity assign meaning to
roles is confusing. Maybe the intent was to say that the other services
have a policy file that defines what operations the roles can do.
Before the v3 API, keystone didn't support RBAC, but now with v3 it
supports RBAC like all the other services.

The note is updated so that hopefully it will now provide usable
information.

Change-Id: I9e57c4244f2e57aedc2f0dffbdf38ee07eb67473
"}]
commit_message:
Update confusing note

The note saying that services other than Identity assign meaning to
roles is confusing. Maybe the intent was to say that the other services
have a policy file that defines what operations the roles can do.
Before the v3 API, keystone didn't support RBAC, but now with v3 it
supports RBAC like all the other services.

The note is updated so that hopefully it will now provide usable
information.

Change-Id: I9e57c4244f2e57aedc2f0dffbdf38ee07eb67473

subject: Revert "Fix wrong type of exception raised"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-21 03:05:56.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_engine_service.py', 'heat/engine/environment.py', 'heat/common/exception.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/resource_group.py', 'heat/tests/test_provider_template.py', 'heat/tests/test_resource_group.py', 'heat/engine/resources/template_resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack_resource.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py', 'heat/engine/service.py', 'heat/tests/test_resource.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Fix wrong type of exception raised"

This reverts commit c5bb4d2ab83820f5ee2ac3fc6e8d9210e98b26ef.

Every part of this patch was wrong, except that it did (by accident)
start returning 500 errors instead of 400 errors in the case where a
template in the global environment was not found, which is actually the
operator's fault and not the user's. That's not really a serious enough
problem to justify changing it on a stable branch though, so this is a
straight revert. Luckily the patch hasn't made it into a release yet.

Change-Id: Ia3154c7c41bb69cfa2ee36eb6d48fcd339900d60
Closes-Bug: #1518458
Related-Bug: #1447194
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Fix wrong type of exception raised"

This reverts commit c5bb4d2ab83820f5ee2ac3fc6e8d9210e98b26ef.

Every part of this patch was wrong, except that it did (by accident)
start returning 500 errors instead of 400 errors in the case where a
template in the global environment was not found, which is actually the
operator's fault and not the user's. That's not really a serious enough
problem to justify changing it on a stable branch though, so this is a
straight revert. Luckily the patch hasn't made it into a release yet.

Change-Id: Ia3154c7c41bb69cfa2ee36eb6d48fcd339900d60
Closes-Bug: #1518458
Related-Bug: #1447194

commit_message:
Use new version scheme to refer to bsnstacklib

Starting from liberty, date-based versions will no longer be used
for Neutron. This fix changes neutron to use the new version scheme
to refer to bsnstacklib
In an earlier commit, bsnstacklib has been updated to use the new
version scheme. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/217896/

Change-Id: I3ba9e47681700a375508176fa5b3e3a2b170daf5

[GET /resources] methods should be "list_<resource name>s"
or "show_<resource name>", so this patch applies the rule
to server_group client.

This patch makes tempest-lib sync for the commit of Tempest
I75307176c2f032301da6227249070c42af54dd6e, but get_server_group has
been released in tempest-lib 1.0.0 already.
So it is difficult to remove it directly for backwards compatibility
and this patch adds warning message for clarifying deprecated method.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I9e321aaf4791e8ff11e3aa114b41eb612db481ca
'}]
commit_message:
Rename get_server_group to show_server_group

[GET /resources] methods should be "list_<resource name>s"
or "show_<resource name>", so this patch applies the rule
to server_group client.

This patch makes tempest-lib sync for the commit of Tempest
I75307176c2f032301da6227249070c42af54dd6e, but get_server_group has
been released in tempest-lib 1.0.0 already.
So it is difficult to remove it directly for backwards compatibility
and this patch adds warning message for clarifying deprecated method.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I9e321aaf4791e8ff11e3aa114b41eb612db481ca

commit_message:
Remove BigSwitch plugin and driver

The BigSwitch Vendor plugin and driver are in
openstack/networking-bigswitch repo and will be moved to
Openstack bigtent. This patch removes the duplicated code and
corresponding entry points. It also moves the bigswitch specific
db tables to openstack/networking-bigswitch.
Closes-Bug: #1508781

Change-Id: I180d93f3e7da347c9b042fcc3f79f19e9a471f52

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-11-06 08:36:38.000000000', 'files': ['tempest_lib/tests/test_ssh.py', 'tempest_lib/common/ssh.py'], 'message': "python3: converts binary data from channel

paramiko returns chunk of binary type.
So code must join all chunks with binary type and not as str.
Also this patchset adds one more parameter 'encoding' for exec
function to decode binary result to str.

Closes-Bug: #1495181
Change-Id: I886c9d0c143d3553876ece7b6d1ac2df7e49d701
"}]
commit_message:
python3: converts binary data from channel

paramiko returns chunk of binary type.
So code must join all chunks with binary type and not as str.
Also this patchset adds one more parameter 'encoding' for exec
function to decode binary result to str.

Closes-Bug: #1495181
Change-Id: I886c9d0c143d3553876ece7b6d1ac2df7e49d701

commit_message:
devref: add upgrade strategy page

The page is intended to describe current upgrade features Neutron
supports, lay out potential improvements, describe testing strategy for
existing and planned upgrade features, and provide guidelines to
reviewers on where to look for potential upgrade breakages in proposed
patches.

Change-Id: I22e55bb2fe32b32d12fa5889b91ecb9f92b3e6a6

commit_message:
Move identity wait until after password is updated

With Ied83448de8af1b0da9afdfe6ce9431438215bfe0 merging, we should be waiting
after the password is updated and before we reauthenticate. This change fixes
this to be correct. For some reason a transient failure didn't cause the tests
to fail.

Change-Id: I7286085325c3578958234176adb7588afdcac578
Closes-Bug: 1473567

servers_client contained T110 violations, and we need to fix them
before migrating the client to tempest-lib for consistent interfaces.

commit_message:
Add ansible-role-zuul project

In this patch, we are just adding ansible-role-zuul into the OpenStack
gerrit workflow. After talking with both openstack-infra and third
party CI teams it was decided to deal with which team this would be
part of at a later date.

Additionally, we have not created a launchpad project for this module
or pypi (since we won't release there).

Gerritbot was also not configured at this time, since we don't know
which team we are going to be part of.

Change-Id: I6424d66fb644c938e53091da11714e3f782f9a7c
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Move get_user_by_username to common part

get_user_by_username of keystone service client is just wrapper method
and it should be moved from the client for implementing it as library.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

commit_message:
[V3] Separating groups_client from identity_client

As the qa-spec of consistent-service-method-names, we have decided
all service client modules will be separated into a single module
by each resource. So this patch separates groups_client from
identity_client.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Iadb49298f41a6307d3b453b365d9b6be31b95781

commit_message:
Option for disabling wait condition feature

It looks like wait condition feature works nice
but there are some issues with that on several deployments.
Added option heat_enable_wait_condition to allow disabling of that.

Closes-bug: 1516784
Change-Id: I082ce0bb4ab8c3c939dcafc2bc821e38c5d760a7

commit_message:
Improve index page layout

Split up draft guides under separate heading and remove draft word for
easier review.

The output looks now basically like:

Generated documents
admin-guide-cloud
contributor-guide
networking-guide
user-guide
user-guide-admin

Draft Guides
arch-design-rst
config-ref-rst
image-guide-rst
install-guide-debian
install-guide-obs
install-guide-rdo
install-guide-ubuntu

Also, create separate tool openstack-indexpage that only generates index
page.

Change-Id: Ic68a674918f18dc37f8b9fa4e9d9f529a8ad131e

commit_message:
Update iLO documentation

This commit fixes the following in iLO documentation:

- Fixes some incorrect information about drivers.
- Fixes some small mistakes like s/Proliant/ProLiant,
  s/nova/Nova, s/baremetal/bare metal, etc.
- Fixes some broken HTTP links and also moves all the
  links inline (removing references like [1], [2], etc)
- Changes a reference of bash ramdisk to agent ramdisk.
- Rebrands HP to HPE. The links are not changed as of now,
  would be updated later once available.

Co-Authored-By: Ramakrishnan G <rameshg87@gmail.com>
Closes-bug: 1511224
Change-Id: I4c065ce0784e73810e9a23390d1148dc13699671

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-11-19 22:31:38.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/config.py'], 'message': "WIP: Increase baremetal active and unprovision timeout to 500s

The new coreos stable images takes little longer to boot and
deploy the os. When used these images results in gate timeout
consistently.

This also may help fix the issue we've been seeing that looks
like TFTP failures. One theory was that slow nodes were taking
too long to provision, but all the timeouts involved seemed
like more than enuogh. However, we totally overlooked this
particular timeout.

Related-Bug: #1393099
Change-Id: I181cd8f02e6612542841f3639a706c27aa902618
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Increase baremetal active and unprovision timeout to 500s

The new coreos stable images takes little longer to boot and
deploy the os. When used these images results in gate timeout
consistently.

This also may help fix the issue we've been seeing that looks
like TFTP failures. One theory was that slow nodes were taking
too long to provision, but all the timeouts involved seemed
like more than enuogh. However, we totally overlooked this
particular timeout.

Related-Bug: #1393099
Change-Id: I181cd8f02e6612542841f3639a706c27aa902618

Currently, when creating an encrypted volume from an image, Cinder
writes raw data to the encrypted volume. When Cinder uploads an
encrypted volume to an image, it writes encrypted data to the image.
As a result, Nova cannot use these images or volumes.

To fix above problem, cinder needs to add encryptor attach/detach
layers.
This patch is the first step. It copies encryptors from Nova to
Cinder, and do following changes:
1. Add --encrypt in end of dev name.
2. Return the new path name in attach_volume().
We can't use Nova encryptors directly as it is also used for local
LVM volumes and remote volumes.

Change-Id: I1669a58cbdf2f7bee390888301c468cbe930b11d
Related-bug: #1482464
Related-bug: #1465656
"}]
commit_message:
Copy encryptors from Nova to Cinder

Currently, when creating an encrypted volume from an image, Cinder
writes raw data to the encrypted volume. When Cinder uploads an
encrypted volume to an image, it writes encrypted data to the image.
As a result, Nova cannot use these images or volumes.

To fix above problem, cinder needs to add encryptor attach/detach
layers.
This patch is the first step. It copies encryptors from Nova to
Cinder, and do following changes:
1. Add --encrypt in end of dev name.
2. Return the new path name in attach_volume().
We can't use Nova encryptors directly as it is also used for local
LVM volumes and remote volumes.

Change-Id: I1669a58cbdf2f7bee390888301c468cbe930b11d
Related-bug: #1482464
Related-bug: #1465656

subject: Avoid to use `run_once`
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-19 09:52:33.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/cinder/tasks/bootstrap.yml', 'ansible/roles/magnum/tasks/bootstrap.yml', 'ansible/roles/ironic/tasks/bootstrap.yml', 'ansible/roles/neutron/tasks/bootstrap.yml', 'ansible/roles/nova/tasks/bootstrap.yml', 'ansible/roles/murano/tasks/bootstrap.yml', 'ansible/roles/heat/tasks/bootstrap.yml', 'ansible/roles/glance/tasks/bootstrap.yml'], 'message': 'Avoid to use `run_once`

Sometimes `Starting * bootstrap container` task doesn't work due to
behavior of `run_once` and `when`.
When `run_once` is used, this task will execute on "the first host",
as defined by inventory, in the group(s) of hosts targeted by the
play[1].

If "the first host" doesn't meet "when" condition, `Starting * bootstrap
container` task will skip.
So we must avoid using with 'run_once' and 'when'.

[1]: http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/playbooks_delegation.html#run-once

Change-Id: I8b0a7a643d76793f17445568d1eea86a16485c8d
Closes-Bug: #1517774
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid to use `run_once`

Sometimes `Starting * bootstrap container` task doesn't work due to
behavior of `run_once` and `when`.
When `run_once` is used, this task will execute on "the first host",
as defined by inventory, in the group(s) of hosts targeted by the
play[1].

If "the first host" doesn't meet "when" condition, `Starting * bootstrap
container` task will skip.
So we must avoid using with 'run_once' and 'when'.

[1]: http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/playbooks_delegation.html#run-once

Change-Id: I8b0a7a643d76793f17445568d1eea86a16485c8d
Closes-Bug: #1517774

This change registers the exception type and

Closes-Bug: #1517652

commit_message:
Handle glanceclient CommunicationError in horizon

When glanceclient throws a CommunicationError,
Horizon doesn't show the error message from the exception
handling code because the exception type CommunicationError
is not recognized.

This change registers the exception type and
adds a unit test case.

Change-Id: I5c6f3df4097a4493b4c88716f30de86e4cde3b4b
Closes-Bug: #1517652

commit_message:
Extending cluster create tempest test

Extending existing cluster create tempest test to include additional
steps for cue-monitor verification.

The additional steps include:
* Stop the first two nodes in the cluster
* Verify VM's have stopped
* Wait until Cluster status goes to 'DOWN'

Change-Id: I6095b2460e24539bd0d8fd8629bce4b73955ccb1

Split instance details and source in Launch Instance wizard.

Per user feedback, the existing wizard step, Select Source,
is being split into two steps - Instance Details and Select Source.

subject: Option to paginate query results
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-10 04:40:38.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/server-side-pagination.rst'], 'message': 'Option to paginate query results

The data source tables can potentially contain a huge number of rows. The
client side is unlikely going to be able to handle presenting the entire
results set to the end user without impacting performance. Use pagination to
break up the results.

Change-Id: I086b23ed18d19c4387adbaaa368bede5aeba7b32
'}]
commit_message:
Option to paginate query results

The data source tables can potentially contain a huge number of rows. The
client side is unlikely going to be able to handle presenting the entire
results set to the end user without impacting performance. Use pagination to
break up the results.

Change-Id: I086b23ed18d19c4387adbaaa368bede5aeba7b32

Commit 0c1f96ad5a6606c1205bd50ea944c3a383892cde broke the ipam
internal driver. The base plugin should only call the ipam interface
and not invoke the IPallocation data model.

The code that validated that the subnet had one free IP address was
removed. This would not guarantee that a port would indeed be free,
that is, a parallel operation could have created a port on the subnet
during this check.

Change-Id: I4d7ecb985762a8eef39cb2f22f210b4899f1a22e
"}]
commit_message:
IPAM: fix 'enable-dhcp' with internal driver

Commit 0c1f96ad5a6606c1205bd50ea944c3a383892cde broke the ipam
internal driver. The base plugin should only call the ipam interface
and not invoke the IPallocation data model.

The code that validated that the subnet had one free IP address was
removed. This would not guarantee that a port would indeed be free,
that is, a parallel operation could have created a port on the subnet
during this check.

Closes-bug: #1514810

Change-Id: I4d7ecb985762a8eef39cb2f22f210b4899f1a22e

commit_message:
Consolidate the fernet provider issue_v3_token()

When the Fernet token provider was implemented, it extended the
provider.common.py:BaseProvider class. It also overrode most all common methods
the BaseProvider implemented. Other token providers in Keystone (like the UUID
an PKI providers) just implemente a _get_token_id method because token ids may
be different across providers.

This commit removes the issue_v3_token() method from the fernet.Provider. This
ensure that the Fernet provider uses the same issue_v3_token() that all the
other token providers use.

Subsequent patches will do the same for issue_v2_token, validate_v3_token, and
validate_v2_token.

Conflicts:
	keystone/token/providers/fernet/core.py

Closes-Bug: #1515485
Change-Id: I03f56c9c84389a6d6cdb3a6863fcbfca486af337
(cherry picked from commit 91a0b29809cb71c1b2df1642d6c34a3f60a801ed)

commit_message:
Fixed AssertionError for running tests

Since some sentences exceeded a maximum of 79 charaters,
runtests job generated AssertionError during testr like:
'AssertionError: False is not true' and 'Line limited to
a maximum of 79 characters.'

This bug fix is for running tox and for Jenkins test.

Change-Id: I6b7292f49daf57b0ba1c2663df8369a20bde5d3e

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-19 02:46:17.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/templates/kubernetes/fragments/configure-docker-storage.sh'], 'message': 'Add support for different disk bus

Different disk bus has different device path, so we should change
our way to find device path.

examples:
virtio => virtio-5e7ef7f7-da5b-4b6c-9
scsi => scsi-0QEMU_QEMU_HARDDISK_ab5b3fab-f848-4a00-8
ide => ata-QEMU_HARDDISK_e4bb1070-3ff0-4470-a

I have confirmed with my colleague who is familiar with qemu.
The device path ends with the prefix of the volume id. For example,
when the volume id is e4bb1070-3ff0-4470-ad5a-3edbb30ae011, the ide
device path is ata-QEMU_HARDDISK_e4bb1070-3ff0-4470-a. The last 20
charaters of device path is same as the first 20 charaters of the
volume id. But I can not find any official docs for it now.

Change-Id: I8fc7aa0c0f8722a24f7189c0a8c118dbb724c1d3
Partially-Implements: blueprint support-for-different-volume-type
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for different disk bus

Different disk bus has different device path, so we should change
our way to find device path.

examples:
virtio => virtio-5e7ef7f7-da5b-4b6c-9
scsi => scsi-0QEMU_QEMU_HARDDISK_ab5b3fab-f848-4a00-8
ide => ata-QEMU_HARDDISK_e4bb1070-3ff0-4470-a

I have confirmed with my colleague who is familiar with qemu.
The device path ends with the prefix of the volume id. For example,
when the volume id is e4bb1070-3ff0-4470-ad5a-3edbb30ae011, the ide
device path is ata-QEMU_HARDDISK_e4bb1070-3ff0-4470-a. The last 20
charaters of device path is same as the first 20 charaters of the
volume id. But I can not find any official docs for it now.

Change-Id: I8fc7aa0c0f8722a24f7189c0a8c118dbb724c1d3
Partially-Implements: blueprint support-for-different-volume-type

subject: Allow in-place updates for all compatible types
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-17 21:40:28.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/update.py', 'heat_integrationtests/functional/test_create_update.py', 'heat/engine/resources/template_resource.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': "Allow in-place updates for all compatible types

We previously only allowed a resource to update in-place when the 'type'
field in the old and new templates matched. In an age of environment type
mappings, this is incorrect. Instead, allow a resource to be updated
in-place when the old and new resource plugins are of the same class, since
this is actually what determines whether handle_update is capable of
correctly updating the resource in-place.

There is a special-case for TemplateResource as we currently subclass it
for each template type, but all TemplateResource subclasses are in fact
capable of converting between each other via a stack update.

Change-Id: Iba4abf5efd9737ca6a17d8c91d5c54ab6d3f12e0
Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1508115
(cherry picked from commit 98044dbd17c703e6062752f043e1cac6563e3589)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow in-place updates for all compatible types

We previously only allowed a resource to update in-place when the 'type'
field in the old and new templates matched. In an age of environment type
mappings, this is incorrect. Instead, allow a resource to be updated
in-place when the old and new resource plugins are of the same class, since
this is actually what determines whether handle_update is capable of
correctly updating the resource in-place.

There is a special-case for TemplateResource as we currently subclass it
for each template type, but all TemplateResource subclasses are in fact
capable of converting between each other via a stack update.

Change-Id: Iba4abf5efd9737ca6a17d8c91d5c54ab6d3f12e0
Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1508115
(cherry picked from commit 98044dbd17c703e6062752f043e1cac6563e3589)

subject: Set "password" as default auth plugin
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-23 22:22:13.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/unit/test_connection.py', 'openstack/connection.py'], 'message': 'Set "password" as default auth plugin

Currently, when None gets passed through a Connection, None gets sent to
keystoneauth to find the None plugin, which doesn't exist. As "password"
is the likely default, we should send "password" through unless
otherwise specified.

Change-Id: Iafe526d88a1b2ceb8b975f01dddb808f43821f0f
'}]
commit_message:
Set "password" as default auth plugin

Currently, when None gets passed through a Connection, None gets sent to
keystoneauth to find the None plugin, which doesn't exist. As "password"
is the likely default, we should send "password" through unless
otherwise specified.

Change-Id: Iafe526d88a1b2ceb8b975f01dddb808f43821f0f

All other actions on the Resource class that are used in Proxy

`self.session` out of proxy calls.

Additionally, while moving the proxy implementations to all be the same,

commit_message:
Add find support to BaseProxy

All other actions on the Resource class that are used in Proxy
subclasses had been exposed in BaseProxy except for find. This change
implements a simple `_find` in the base, which brings it in line with
how everything else is done, and is the last piece to get knowledge of
`self.session` out of proxy calls.

Additionally, while moving the proxy implementations to all be the same,
it's a chance to unify the find tests in the proxy. This change
eliminates the need for there to have been two test methods and makes
the tests look like how they're done for every other action.

Change-Id: Ibea01bed4e4ecd76d96021f78db0116012448984
Closes-Bug: 1517149

commit_message:
Changed Stackforge explanation for retirement

Since Stackforge is retiring, two slides: 'What is
Stackforge for' and 'How to add a project to Stackforge'
is not needed for training materials.

Stackforge is currently in migrating status, and
it is used before TC's decision on August 2015,
IMO it is better to keep 'Stackforge' slide.
So some content related to Stackforge was modified
with Stackforge retired and current status.

Change-Id: Ia7026acfde12d129781d90e575bb3caa3d6609aa
Closes-Bug: #1490471

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-10 19:23:07.000000000', 'files': ['stackviz/export.py'], 'message': 'Edit stackviz-export export_tempest_details to save logs

export_tempest_details (responsible for generating the details file in
the stackviz-export process) had strip_details set to True, discarding
all pertinent log info necessary for a full details view. This changes
the strip_details method parameter to the default, False.

'}]
commit_message:
Edit stackviz-export export_tempest_details to save logs

export_tempest_details (responsible for generating the details file in
the stackviz-export process) had strip_details set to True, discarding
all pertinent log info necessary for a full details view. This changes
the strip_details method parameter to the default, False.

Change-Id: I293ccd15e6c0e7b1ba5f7ee9be12584e01d398b6

Remove shadowed ConnectionError

ConnectionError is redefined later in this module, so the original
ConnectionError isn't visible outside the module. Remove the
original ConnectionError so the code is less confusing.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-20 16:22:09.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/neutron/utilsv2.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/neutron/test_utilsv2.py'], 'message': 'Caches Hyper-V vSwitches

Hyper-V vSwitches are queried for each port that is being bound.
There is no need to query them each time, caching them can
significantly improve performance.

Change-Id: Ibd82775f07d81599fa6d16638af351d2a70f5f4a
Partial-Bug: #1505196
'}]
commit_message:
Caches Hyper-V vSwitches

Hyper-V vSwitches are queried for each port that is being bound.
There is no need to query them each time, caching them can
significantly improve performance.

Change-Id: Ibd82775f07d81599fa6d16638af351d2a70f5f4a
Partial-Bug: #1505196

commit_message:
Move validation of compiled unit out of compiler

Instead of having the compiler do any validation on the
graph it has created instead have the compiler just compile
and have the engine that uses that compiled result do any
post compilation validation instead.

This makes it more clear that the compiler just compiles a
flow (and tasks and nested flows) into a graph, and that is
all that it does.

Change-Id: I96a35d732dc2be9fc8bc8dc6466256a19ac2df6d

commit_message:
Allow provided flow to be empty

If someone really wants to provide a flow to run that is
empty that is there prerogative so it doesn't seem that valuable
to blow up if they do this.

commit_message:
Pin mime-types gem to 2.6.2 to fix CI

mime-types 3.0 requires mime-types-data gem and ruby>=2.0, which
breaks gate-fuel-library-puppet-lint job.
We can pin mime-types gem to 2.6.2 as a workaround, until
gate-fuel-library-puppet-lint is switched to ruby 2.0 environment

Change-Id: I4ee0514a72821bd6a27a5a0f068107c134e0dc60
Closes-Bug: #1518957
(cherry picked from commit aff0b7f9265480af46d1e87ee20e23a30407e191)

subject: Fix a string vs bytes issue in _guess_cgit_link
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-23 14:06:20.000000000', 'files': ['oslosphinx/__init__.py'], 'message': "Fix a string vs bytes issue in _guess_cgit_link

subprocess.check_output returns bytes, so we end up using '+' on a text
string (CGIT_BASE) and bytes (the output of parsed.path) in
_guess_cgit_link. Make sure we decode 'git_remote' in Python 3.

Change-Id: I9e846e2192ead41ca2328b8aa20994742096c51e
Closes-Bug: #1517525
"}]
commit_message:
Fix a string vs bytes issue in _guess_cgit_link

subprocess.check_output returns bytes, so we end up using '+' on a text
string (CGIT_BASE) and bytes (the output of parsed.path) in
_guess_cgit_link. Make sure we decode 'git_remote' in Python 3.

Change-Id: I9e846e2192ead41ca2328b8aa20994742096c51e
Closes-Bug: #1517525

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-08 16:50:53.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_protection.py', 'etc/policy.v3cloudsample.json'], 'message': 'Fix for listing role assignments by project admin

Project admin fails to list role assignments for his project with
Project Scoped Token.
The issue is project admin in default policy file
(policy.v3cloudsample.json) does not have access to get details
of his project. Due to this, keystone assumes that the project
does not exist, and tries to get the project listing which again
fails.
This change updates the default policy file to let project
administrators to retrieve their own project details.

Change-Id: I025a94d23b7e4eb0a2bffd1db6da92496783264f
Closes-Bug: 1418702
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for listing role assignments by project admin

Project admin fails to list role assignments for his project with
Project Scoped Token.
The issue is project admin in default policy file
(policy.v3cloudsample.json) does not have access to get details
of his project. Due to this, keystone assumes that the project
does not exist, and tries to get the project listing which again
fails.
This change updates the default policy file to let project
administrators to retrieve their own project details.

Change-Id: I025a94d23b7e4eb0a2bffd1db6da92496783264f
Closes-Bug: 1418702

subject: Sample environment with old ServiceNetMap value
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-23 18:08:26.000000000', 'files': ['environments/updates/update-from-keystone-admin-internal-api.yaml', 'environments/updates/README.md'], 'message': "Sample environment with old ServiceNetMap value

The original value for the ServiceNetMap parameter had the Keystone
Admin API service on the Internal API network. Later, it was moved to
the ctlplane network by default.

Users updating from clouds already deployed may not want to have the
service moved, and we've occassionly seen it cause issues with services
not getting restarted properly.

This sample environment file documents the old value so that users can
just optionally include it via -e to keep the services the same as they
were when they originally deployed.

Change-Id: I0b68542337a2f40e26df15fe7ac2da5aafe651d5
"}]
commit_message:
Sample environment with old ServiceNetMap value

The original value for the ServiceNetMap parameter had the Keystone
Admin API service on the Internal API network. Later, it was moved to
the ctlplane network by default.

Users updating from clouds already deployed may not want to have the
service moved, and we've occassionly seen it cause issues with services
not getting restarted properly.

This sample environment file documents the old value so that users can
just optionally include it via -e to keep the services the same as they
were when they originally deployed.

Change-Id: I0b68542337a2f40e26df15fe7ac2da5aafe651d5

subject: Clean up legacy multi-version test constructs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-23 18:32:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py'], 'message': "Clean up legacy multi-version test constructs

This removes MyObj2 and MyObjDiffVers from the tests, and fixes up the
tests that still use them to use the more modern manifest-based approach,
which is much cleaner and doesn't require strangely subclassed objects
to mimic the multi-version environment during an upgrade.

It also removes a few tests that still do some basic validation on the
object registry, which is now fully contained (and tested) inside of
oslo.versionedobjects.

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py

Change-Id: Ia523f3264b0ea54573e54c258efd7a07158ded36
Depends-On: Icbbb78cfcd074b0050e60c54557637af723f9b92
(cherry picked from commit 8cc7c938955dc5e5b1d2f75b249738a499aa5d79)
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up legacy multi-version test constructs

This removes MyObj2 and MyObjDiffVers from the tests, and fixes up the
tests that still use them to use the more modern manifest-based approach,
which is much cleaner and doesn't require strangely subclassed objects
to mimic the multi-version environment during an upgrade.

It also removes a few tests that still do some basic validation on the
object registry, which is now fully contained (and tested) inside of
oslo.versionedobjects.

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py

Change-Id: Ia523f3264b0ea54573e54c258efd7a07158ded36
Depends-On: Icbbb78cfcd074b0050e60c54557637af723f9b92
(cherry picked from commit 8cc7c938955dc5e5b1d2f75b249738a499aa5d79)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-23 17:43:00.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/cinder/tasks/bootstrap.yml', 'ansible/roles/ironic/tasks/bootstrap.yml', 'ansible/roles/neutron/tasks/bootstrap.yml', 'ansible/roles/nova/tasks/bootstrap.yml', 'ansible/roles/murano/tasks/bootstrap.yml', 'ansible/roles/heat/tasks/bootstrap.yml', 'ansible/roles/keystone/tasks/bootstrap.yml', 'ansible/roles/glance/tasks/bootstrap.yml'], 'message': 'Incorrect parsed variable name

database_user_create was not correctly referenced when parsing the
variable names. This could never actually lead to a situation that
reported a false change, but it could break an operation if you were
using the --step option with ansible and skipped the database create
task.

TrivialFix
Backport: Liberty

Partial-Bug: #1519040
Change-Id: Idf69fffcc3814f509448ccea11b7d175f074ccf1
(cherry picked from commit 6b283430173caf0d0ecabce55dfa62abfe68787a)
'}]
commit_message:
Incorrect parsed variable name

database_user_create was not correctly referenced when parsing the
variable names. This could never actually lead to a situation that
reported a false change, but it could break an operation if you were
using the --step option with ansible and skipped the database create
task.

TrivialFix
Backport: Liberty

Partial-Bug: #1519040
Change-Id: Idf69fffcc3814f509448ccea11b7d175f074ccf1
(cherry picked from commit 6b283430173caf0d0ecabce55dfa62abfe68787a)

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-11-19 21:51:54.000000000', 'files': ['cue/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'cue/tests/functional/db/test_models.py', 'cue/taskflow/flow/create_cluster_node.py', 'cue/tests/functional/taskflow/flow/test_create_cluster.py', 'cue/taskflow/flow/create_cluster.py', 'os_tasklib/common/check_for.py', 'cue/api/controllers/v1/cluster.py', 'cue/objects/cluster.py', 'cue/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/17c428e0479e_add_cluster_error_detail_column.py', 'cue/taskflow/task/update_cluster_record_task.py', 'cue/tests/functional/db/manage/database/test_migration.py'], 'message': "Adding support for error details on cluster creation

Cue's current implementation does not provide any additional information
to the user related to why a cluster went into ERROR state during
cluster creation.  This patch adds error_detail field in the
clusters table and exposes this field through the API.  The
update_cluster_task now extracts failure flow details and forwards this
information on cluster record update.

Partial-Bug:  1508730
(updates also required to Cue client and dashboard)
Closes-bug:  1516735
Change-Id: I440fec30bc3d051189585479b8d2c1219a98cf40
"}]
commit_message:
Adding support for error details on cluster creation

Cue's current implementation does not provide any additional information
to the user related to why a cluster went into ERROR state during
cluster creation.  This patch adds error_detail field in the
clusters table and exposes this field through the API.  The
update_cluster_task now extracts failure flow details and forwards this
information on cluster record update.

Partial-Bug:  1508730
(updates also required to Cue client and dashboard)
Closes-bug:  1516735
Change-Id: I440fec30bc3d051189585479b8d2c1219a98cf40

subject: Fix: Next cleaning hangs if the previous cleaning was aborted
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6637, 'name': 'Sam Betts', 'email': 'sam@code-smash.net', 'username': 'sambetts'}, {'_account_id': 8125, 'name': 'Michael Davies', 'email': 'michael@the-davies.net', 'username': 'mrda'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10343, 'name': 'Jim Rollenhagen', 'email': 'jim@jimrollenhagen.com', 'username': 'jimrollenhagen'}, {'_account_id': 11076, 'name': 'Shivanand Tendulker', 'email': 'stendulker@gmail.com', 'username': 'stendulker'}, {'_account_id': 14923, 'name': 'Sinval Vieira Mendes Neto', 'email': 'sinvalneto01@gmail.com', 'username': 'sinvalvieira'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-20 16:06:52.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_manager.py'], 'message': 'Fix: Next cleaning hangs if the previous cleaning was aborted

When cleaning is abort Ironic leaves the node's clean_step field
populated with the step that was running at the moment. Because of that,
once the next cleaning starts again (after the node have been moved to
"manageable" and in the transition to "available") it will hang and
never finish, the reason for that is because once the node starts
heartbeating again Ironic won't know if the cleaning just started or
it's just continuing cleaning (it uses clean_step as a flag for it,
see the bug linked with this patch).

This patch fix this by cleaning up the node's clean_field once the
cleaning process is aborted.

Closes-Bug: #1518374
Change-Id: I423e89f9574a8952875ad9f03ce33298cb5660e7
'}]
commit_message:
Fix: Next cleaning hangs if the previous cleaning was aborted

When cleaning is abort Ironic leaves the node's clean_step field
populated with the step that was running at the moment. Because of that,
once the next cleaning starts again (after the node have been moved to
"manageable" and in the transition to "available") it will hang and
never finish, the reason for that is because once the node starts
heartbeating again Ironic won't know if the cleaning just started or
it's just continuing cleaning (it uses clean_step as a flag for it,
see the bug linked with this patch).

This patch fix this by cleaning up the node's clean_field once the
cleaning process is aborted.

Closes-Bug: #1518374
Change-Id: I423e89f9574a8952875ad9f03ce33298cb5660e7

commit_message:
Add clean up method for the DHCP factory

The DHCP provider base class has only update methods to notify the
provider which DHCP BOOT options to reserve when a node comes up. If anyone
wants to create his own DHCP provider implementation for Ironic, none of
the base class methods get triggered after a node is deleted, so the DHCP
reservations will be present even after the Ironic node is deleted.

This patch adds a 'clean_dhcp' method to the DHCPFactory class, which is used
to clean the DHCP BOOT options. This is called when an Ironic node is torn down.

Closes-Bug: #1498923
Change-Id: Iec768268323204b39fa80731e22a2511c7ac7763

commit_message:
Resolve issue where router can't be removed from L3-agent in dvr mode

Fixes the problem where the L3 DVR Scheduler is unable
to remove a DVR router from a L3 agent running in
'dvr' mode.

Closes-bug: 1489091
Change-Id: Id128a81d2cf7108936715ee305012fbff23ffdbf
(cherry picked from commit 3de01b39b74d0a23f765b1f9b1a4ba1eb457068c)

commit_message:
Implement Advanced Firewalling support

Consume puppet-tripleo to create/manage IPtables from Heat templates.

This review put in place the logic to enable and setup firewall rules.

A known set of rules are applied. More to come.

Change-Id: Ib79c23fb27fe3fc03bf223e6922d896cb33dad22
Co-Authored-By: Yanis Guenane <yguenane@redhat.com>
Depends-On: I144c60db2a568a94dce5b51257f1d10980173325

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-29 13:32:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: Log warning for wrong migration flag config options

The config options live_migration_flag and block_migration_flag
of the [libvirt] section set the flags for the hypervisor for the
live-migration operation. It is possible to set the flags in a way
that every live-migration will be a block-migration and vice versa.
This doesn't make sense and is a misconfiguration.

Because some customers could already have configured their systems in
this faulty way, this patch set logs a warning if it discovers this,
instead of blocking the nova-compute service to come up.

Closes-Bug: #1499041
Change-Id: I37f1e90c8a86a1dcf0fc1e699a018e0784c66e48
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Log warning for wrong migration flag config options

The config options live_migration_flag and block_migration_flag
of the [libvirt] section set the flags for the hypervisor for the
live-migration operation. It is possible to set the flags in a way
that every live-migration will be a block-migration and vice versa.
This doesn't make sense and is a misconfiguration.

Because some customers could already have configured their systems in
this faulty way, this patch set logs a warning if it discovers this,
instead of blocking the nova-compute service to come up.

Closes-Bug: #1499041

commit_message:
Cause forbidden when deactivating image(non-admin)

If a user tries to deactivate an image that is hosted by the admin that
has public visiblity, it will currently return a 500 error. This changes
that behaviour to return a Forbidden.

Closes-Bug: 1485940
Change-Id: Id7f645fc599e57f6c0842bba2b7a2f3db52784ae

commit_message:
Create openstack-infra/log_processor project

Create a project for the python files currently managed in
openstack-infra/puppet-log_processor. These scripts have grown to the
point were they should be made a proper python module. The scripts have
been copied to github.com/jesusaurus/log_processor preserving git
history using git-filter-branch.

Change-Id: I365e9272101f87761533169700193e6d19d2741a

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded LDAP group schema from emulated enabled mix-in

The emulated enabled mix-in uses hard-coded LDAP schema for the
group objectclass and membership attributes.  This patch makes the
mix-in optionally use the LDAP group configuration settings.

Change-Id: I5ed9d552ec140f83578398fd29e2130ebf827662
Closes-Bug: #1515302
(cherry picked from commit e465de5b44ffb1da65eab77ba7c81d1c0ced367f)

commit_message:
Moved node list to default application state

Rather than having a placeholder as the main view of
the application, we've moved the node list to the root
of the application. This brings the primary resource
for ironic to the forefront and immediately gives the
user something to do.

Change-Id: I6aaca2af1acd0ddeac58f1295438e64d45afaad2

commit_message:
Introduced Root State

The introduction of a root state permits us to move the overall
application layout to a location that is common to the entire
application. It reduces template duplication, and allows us
to specifically target view containers at any level of the
ui framework.

The ApplicationController has been renamed to describe its
new function, and a new 'main.html' template was added.
Note that there are quite a few whitespace changes, as
the indentation of many files changed when the encapsulating
div container moved to the global template.

Change-Id: I2d0b7147903f0af0560cd33903a1e6e4df309f55

subject: Dynamically reconfiguring resources
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-19 18:18:05.000000000', 'files': ['app/js/modules/api/ironic_chassis.js', 'test/js/api/ironic_driver.js', 'app/js/modules/api/ironic_driver.js', 'test/js/api/module.js', 'test/js/api/ironic_node.js', 'test/js/openstack/dummy_resource.js', 'app/js/modules/openstack/dummy_resource.js', 'karma.conf.js', 'test/js/api/ironic_chassis.js', 'app/js/modules/api/ironic_node.js', 'app/js/modules/openstack/resource.js', 'app/js/modules/api/module.js', 'app/js/modules/api/ironic_port.js', 'test/js/api/ironic_port.js'], 'message': "Dynamically reconfiguring resources

This patch makes use of the new $$configuration provider,
the $$selectedConfiguration provider, and the $resourceCache,
to allow hot-swapping the current API without having to reload
the page. It also splits these resources out of the module.js file
into individual files (one file per thing best practice), adds tests,
and updates the coverage threshold accordingly.

The old resource factory method has been removed, as individual
service definitions have been pushed into the services themselves.
This gives them greater control over which actions they expose,
and what URL's those actions map to.

An edge case was identified which, due to the asynchronous
nature of configuration loading, could result in an API
request being issued while the selected configuration is either
invalid or not yet available. For this purpose a $$dummyResource
provider was added, so that the system does not throw
unexpected errors.

Change-Id: I7f6542631266d481e5b847a7e4b9d08057801ba8
"}]
commit_message:
Dynamically reconfiguring resources

This patch makes use of the new $$configuration provider,
the $$selectedConfiguration provider, and the $resourceCache,
to allow hot-swapping the current API without having to reload
the page. It also splits these resources out of the module.js file
into individual files (one file per thing best practice), adds tests,
and updates the coverage threshold accordingly.

The old resource factory method has been removed, as individual
service definitions have been pushed into the services themselves.
This gives them greater control over which actions they expose,
and what URL's those actions map to.

An edge case was identified which, due to the asynchronous
nature of configuration loading, could result in an API
request being issued while the selected configuration is either
invalid or not yet available. For this purpose a $$dummyResource
provider was added, so that the system does not throw
unexpected errors.

Change-Id: I7f6542631266d481e5b847a7e4b9d08057801ba8

commit_message:
Report stack_status_reason on heat failure

When stack create fails, report the status reason, instead
of just the status. This gives the user useful information about
the cause of the failure (out of floating IPs, etc.) instead of
just "CREATE_FAILED".

Change-Id: Ibbaf14e8959cecfade98d13f8101e333eb76ee6e
Closes-Bug: 1516016
(cherry picked from commit dec8f7ab922c2ab454afe9c58842650ba701a2cc)

commit_message:
Set logging level same as other fuel services

Astute was the only fuel service using short ERR and CRIT log levels,
it led to unconvinient log viewing using the WebUI.

Change-Id: I3dd8e7d80030f6a16d910ee28950102b31765af5
Closes-bug: #1286110

commit_message:
Made Decision Engine extensible via stevedore

The objective for this is to give the ability to extend the default
set of placement algorithms (i.e. strategies) currently available
in Watcher using Stevedore.

Now, you can add your new strategy as an entry point under the
'[watcher_strategies]' section.

Change-Id: I4aecf629015e41b0389d07e47220333e50bbbe1a

commit_message:
Add response params for GET image members

This commit adds following params into response parameter for
GET v2/images{image_id}/members:
  * members
  * created_at
  * image_id
  * member_id
  * status
  * updated_at
  * schema(member)

Change-Id: Iad31516e70f4ae2ab4f2a82eea79042b6ab453a3
Closes-Bug: #1518880

[{'number': 14, 'created': '2015-11-10 06:45:13.000000000', 'files': ['guidelines/microversion_specification.rst'], 'message': 'Add introduction for API microversion guideline

This specification is reference to Nova and Ironic API
microversion implementation:
https://github.com/openstack/nova-specs/blob/master/specs/kilo/implemented/api-microversions.rst
https://github.com/openstack/ironic-specs/blob/master/specs/kilo/api-microversions.rst

Current API microversion is different from common versioning SemVer,
so it is nice to go forward with small steps for bulding a consensus.

Change-Id: Ie10b8cf78fab43f437ae3ec7adb7f243de0505af
'}]
commit_message:
Add introduction for API microversion guideline

This specification is reference to Nova and Ironic API
microversion implementation:
https://github.com/openstack/nova-specs/blob/master/specs/kilo/implemented/api-microversions.rst
https://github.com/openstack/ironic-specs/blob/master/specs/kilo/api-microversions.rst

Current API microversion is different from common versioning SemVer,
so it is nice to go forward with small steps for bulding a consensus.

Change-Id: Ie10b8cf78fab43f437ae3ec7adb7f243de0505af

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-11-12 22:02:15.000000000', 'files': ['guidelines/errors-schema.json', 'guidelines/errors.rst', 'guidelines/errors-example.json'], 'message': 'A guideline for errors

Errors are a crucial part of the developer experience when using an API. As
developers learn the API they inevitably run into errors. The quality and
consistency of the error messages returned to them will play a large part
in how quickly they can learn the API, how they can be more effective with
the API, and how much they enjoy using the API.

We need consistency across all services for the error format returned in
the response body.

Change-Id: Iae6dc4d84c11c95a97d2451668ebffa80c9821ec
'}]
commit_message:
A guideline for errors

Errors are a crucial part of the developer experience when using an API. As
developers learn the API they inevitably run into errors. The quality and
consistency of the error messages returned to them will play a large part
in how quickly they can learn the API, how they can be more effective with
the API, and how much they enjoy using the API.

We need consistency across all services for the error format returned in
the response body.

Change-Id: Iae6dc4d84c11c95a97d2451668ebffa80c9821ec

commit_message:
config options: enhance help text of section "serial_console"

The help text of the config options got enhanced to improve the quality
of their documentation. I used a syntax which is in the ReST format.

bp centralize-config-options

Change-Id: I01a2070691035126b8d92be6e810ac3339347b75
